The #coronavirus is mainly transmitted through droplets generated when an infected person coughs, sneezes or speaks.

To protect yourself:
-keep 1m distance from others
-disinfect surfaces frequently
-wash/rub your üëê
-avoid touching your üëÄüëÉüëÑ https://t.co/fpkcpHAJx7

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros üëá https://t.co/LJwbrigVPJ

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"I‚Äôd like to end with something Singapore‚Äôs Minister of Health, @GANKIMYONG, said during today‚Äôs briefing.

We are only at the beginning of this fight. 

We need to stay calm, stay united and work together"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Thank you for your efforts to work with us to protect the health systems, #healthworkers and members of the general public who rely on our information systems and digital tools"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronaviru https://t.co/M11m4O5zF2

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "I am very grateful to those working in various national organizations providing critical cybersecurity intelligence to the WHO Cybersecurity team"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"I‚Äôve said before that crises like this bring out the best & worst in humanity.
We have recently seen an increase in scams, cyberattacks & impersonation using WHO, my name & #COVID19"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "The English version of our @WhatsApp Health Alert now has more than 12 million users, and the Arabic, French and Spanish versions were launched today. More languages will be added, incl Bangla, Chinese, Hindi, Kurdish, Portuguese, Russian, Somali, Urdu & more"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We‚Äôre also delighted to report that the #COVID19 Solidarity Fund has now received donations of more than USD 108M, from 203,000 individuals & organizations. 

Thank you to each and every one of you"-@DrTedros #coronavirus 
https://t.co/YcE5JHCDBq

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "More than 1 million health workers have been trained through our courses on https://t.co/RjHSBkVjlH. We will continue to train more"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"WHO is continuing to support all countries in the response. 
We‚Äôve published more than 40 guidance documents on our website, providing detailed, evidence-based recommendations for governments, hospitals, health workers, members of the public & more"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "As the #COVID19 pandemic evolves & more countries are affected, we are learning more about what works & what doesn't"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"During the most recent #Ebola epidemic, for example, some medicines that were thought to be effective were found not to be as effective as other medicines when they were compared during a clinical trial.

We must follow the evidence. There are no shortcuts"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "The history of medicine is strewn with examples of drugs that worked on paper, or in a test tube, but didn't work in humans or were actually harmful"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "In the meantime, we call on individuals & countries to refrain from using therapeutics that have not been demonstrated to be effective in the treatment of #COVID19"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "This is a historic trial which will dramatically cut the time needed to generate robust evidence about what üíä work. Over 45 countries are contributing to the trial & more have expressed interest. The more countries who join the trial, the faster we will have results"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Today we are delighted to announce that today in üá≥üá¥ & üá™üá∏, the first patients will shortly be enrolled in the Solidarity Trial, which will compare the safety & effectiveness of four different drugs or drug combinations against #COVID19"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"A vaccine is still at least 18 months away. 

In the meantime, we recognize that there is an urgent need for therapeutics to treat patients & save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "To support our call on all countries to conduct aggressive case-finding and testing, we‚Äôre also working urgently to massively increase the production and capacity for testing around the world"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"When #healthworkers are at risk, we‚Äôre all at risk.

Health workers in low- & middle-income countries deserve the same protection as those in the wealthiest countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"WHO has shipped almost 2M individual items of protective gear to 74 countries that need it most & we‚Äôre preparing to send a similar amount to a further 60 countries.
But much more is needed. This problem can only be solved with intl cooperation & solidarity. "-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Countries also expressed several common challenges.

The chronic global shortage of personal protective equipment is now one of the most urgent threats to our collective ability to save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Several common themes emerged about what has worked: 
-The need for early detection & isolation of confirmed cases
-Identification, follow-up & quarantine of contacts
-The need to optimize care
-The need to communicate to build trust & engage communities in the fight"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Earlier today, we held a briefing with around 50 Ministers of Health from around the world at which üá®üá≥üáØüáµüá∞üá∑& üá∏üá¨ shared their experiences and the lessons they have learned"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"This is especially important for countries who are not part of the @g20org but will be affected by decisions made by G20 countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19 
https://t.co/K9Yh8Af1Np

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Viral outbreaks are a fact of life. How much damage they do is something we can influence. I thank the @g20org countries for their commitment to fight the #COVID19 pandemic, safeguard the üåç economy, address intl. trade disruptions & enhance global cooperation"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"And ignite the industrial might and innovation of the @g20org to produce and distribute the tools needed to save lives.

We must also make a promise to future generations: never again"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Fight to stop the #coronavirus with every resource at our disposal;

Unite to confront the #COVID19 pandemic together. We are one humanity, with one, common enemy. No country can fight alone; we can only fight together"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Yesterday, I had the honour of addressing an extraordinary meeting of leaders from the @g20org countries.

My message was threefold: we must fight, unite & ignite"-@DrTedros #COVID19 
https://t.co/jO5SIpYfnc

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"There are now more than 1/2 a million confirmed cases of #COVID19 & more than 20,000 deaths.
These are tragic numbers, but let's also remember that around the üåç, there are hundreds of thousands of survivors"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

‚ùóÔ∏èSharing tobacco products can transmit the virus btw. people
‚ùóÔ∏èTobacco weakens your respiratory system making you more vulnerable to the virus https://t.co/5xFVxxx4ZJ

Follow the advice from WHO üëâ https://t.co/bx8RdTRFz8 #coronavirus https://t.co/ThEpL7lLJv

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: The full address by @DrTedros at the @g20org Summit on #COVID19 üëâ https://t.co/mwBmpRb8EA #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: .@g20org tasked WHO & other relevant orgs with assessing gaps in pandemic preparedness & report the findings of this assessment to the G20 Finance & Health Ministers, in order to establish a global initiative on pandemic preparedness & response together. https://t.co/pdw8XIAYyq

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: .@g20org pledged to work together to increase research and development funding for #COVID19 vaccines and medicines, strengthen international scientific cooperation, and leverage digital technologies. https://t.co/JlSYDn2NmM

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: The @g20org committed to support & further strengthen WHO‚Äôs mandate in coordinating the #COVID19 response & called for full funding of WHO‚Äòs Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan üëâ https://t.co/JlSYDnkoLm

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
.@DrTedros welcomed @g20org commitment ‚Äúto do whatever it takes to overcome the #COVID19 pandemic‚Äù:
-protect lives & livelihoods
-restore confidence & shore up stability currently threatened in trade & other sectors
-take all necessary health measures
-ensure adequate financing

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"3‚É£ ignite.
Repurpose the industrial might of your nations for this effort:
-Ignite üåç production for the tools we need to save lives now
-Ignite innovation for vaccines & therapeutics
-Ignite a üåç movement to ensure this never happens again"-@DrTedros at @g20org Summit #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"2‚É£ unite.
No country can solve this crisis alone. That means a paradigm shift in global solidarity ‚Äì in sharing experiences, expertise & resources & in working together to keep supply lines open & supporting nations who need our support"-@DrTedros at @g20org Summit on #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Today, I have 3‚É£ requests for our esteemed leaders:
1‚É£ fight. Fight hard. Fight like hell.
Fight like your lives depend on it ‚Äì because they do.
The best & only way to protect life, livelihoods & economies is to stop the #coronavirus"-@DrTedros at @g20org Summit on #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"The full social, economic and political fallout, only time will tell. But we know that the price we end up paying depends on the choices we make now.
This is a global crisis that demands a global response"-@DrTedros at @g20org Summit on #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"The #COVID19 pandemic is accelerating at an exponential rate.

The first 100,000 cases took 67 days.

The second 100,000 took 11 days.

The third 100,000 took just 4 days.

The fourth 100,000 just 2 days.

Without aggressive action in all countries, millions could die"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We come together to confront the defining health crisis of our time. We are at war with a virus that threatens to tear us apart ‚Äì if we let it.
Almost 0.5 million people have already been infected & more than 20,000 have lost their lives"-@DrTedros at @g20org Summit on #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: .@DrTedros calls on @g20org to Fight, Unite, and Ignite against #COVID19 üëâhttps://t.co/JlSYDnkoLm #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros üëáhttps://t.co/Y0YRVkvcCp

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "In these difficult times, film & other media are a powerful way not only of communicating important health messages, but of administering one of the most powerful medicines ‚Äì hope"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #Film4Health

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We will be showing all the short-listed films in the coming weeks on our website and social media channels"-@DrTedros #Film4Health

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We received 1,300+ entries from 110 countries & today we are announcing a short list of 45 excellent short films about vital health topics. 
We're also announcing a distinguished panel of jurors who will judge the short list, with the winners to be announced in May"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"The #COVID19 pandemic has highlighted the need for compelling & creative communications about public health. 

Last year, WHO announced our first #HealthForAll Film Festival. The volume, quality and diversity of entries far surpassed our expectations"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Physical distance doesn‚Äôt mean social distance. 
We all need to check in regularly on older parents, neighbors, friends or relatives who live alone or in care homes in whatever way is possible, so they know how much they are loved and valued"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We need to work together to protect older people from the #coronavirus, and to ensure their needs are being met ‚Äì for food, fuel, prescription medication and human interaction"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"They [older people] are at higher risk of the more serious complications of #COVID19.
We are listening to older people and those who work with and for them, to identify how best we can support them"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Although we are especially concerned about vulnerable countries, all countries have vulnerable populations, incl. older people. Older people carry the collective wisdom of our societies. They are valued & valuable members of our families and communities"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We‚Äôre grateful to the over 200K individuals & orgs who have contributed to the #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund. Since we launched it less than 2 weeks ago, the fund has raised over USD 95M. I offer my deep thanks to @GSK for its generous contribution of USD 10M"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We also welcome the Secretary-General‚Äôs call for a global ceasefire. We are all facing a common threat, and the only way to defeat it is by coming together as one humanity"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus 
https://t.co/X3gBe4X3R9

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "This [#COVID19] is much more than a health crisis, and we‚Äôre committed to working as one @UN to protect the world‚Äôs most vulnerable people from the virus, and its consequences"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Together with our partners in the @UN, today we've launched the Global Humanitarian appeal, to support the most fragile countries who have already suffered years of acute humanitarian crises"-@DrTedros #COVID19 
https://t.co/kSuvweOcdb

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "This is especially relevant for many vulnerable countries whose health systems may collapse under the weight of the numbers of patients we've seen in some countries with community transmission"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"More than 150 countries & territories still have fewer than 100 cases.
By taking the same aggressive actions now, these countries have the chance to prevent community transmission & avoid some of the more severe social & economic costs seen in other countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Aggressive measures to find, isolate, test, treat and trace are not only the best and fastest way out of extreme social and economic restrictions ‚Äì they‚Äôre also the best way to prevent them"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "These measures are the best way to suppress & stop transmission, so that when restrictions are lifted, the #coronavirus doesn‚Äôt resurge. The last thing any country needs is to open schools & businesses, only to be forced to close them again because of a resurgence"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"...
-Identify, adapt and equip facilities you will use to treat & isolate patients
-Develop a clear plan & process to quarantine contacts
-Refocus the whole of government on suppressing & controlling #COVID19"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"You have created a 2nd window of opportunity. How will you use it?
-Expand, train & deploy your health care & public health workforce
-Implement a system to find every suspected case at community level
-Ramp up the production, capacity & availability of testing"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"The point of these actions is to enable the more precise and targeted measures that are needed to stop transmission and save lives.

We call on all countries who have introduced so-called ‚Äúlockdown‚Äù measures to use this time to attack the #coronavirus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Asking people to stay at home and shutting down population movement is buying time and reducing the pressure on health systems.

But on their own, these measures will not extinguish epidemics"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We understand that these countries are now trying to assess when and how they will be able to ease these measures.
The answer depends on what countries do while these population-wide measures are in place"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "To slow the spread of #COVID19, many countries have introduced unprecedented measures, at significant social and economic cost ‚Äì closing schools and businesses, cancelling sporting events and asking people to stay home and stay safe"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Already we have lost more than 16,000 lives. We know we will lose more ‚Äì how many more will be determined by the decisions we make and the actions we take"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We have overcome many pandemics and crises before. We will overcome this one too.
The question is how large a price we will pay"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "I thank PM @AbeShinzo & the members of the @Olympics for making this sacrifice to protect the health of athletes, spectators & officials. We look forward to next year's Olympics & Paralympics, which we hope will be a bigger & better celebration of our shared humanity"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"The #COVID19 pandemic continues to take a massive toll not just on health, but on so many parts of life.

Yesterday, the Government of üáØüáµ & the Intl. @Olympics Committee took a difficult but wise decision to postpone @Tokyo2020 Games"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: Media briefing on #COVID19 with @DrTedros. #coronavirus https://t.co/4xooJ592ys

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"History will judge us on how we responded to the poorest communities in their darkest hour.

Let‚Äôs act together, right now!"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Our message to all countries is clear: heed this warning now, back this plan politically & financially today & we can save lives & slow the spread of the #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "6‚É£ we need to protect the health and humanitarian supply chain so that our frontline workers are protected and able to travel freely as they give lifesaving care"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "5‚É£ we‚Äôre building the ship as we sail and it‚Äôs critical that we continue to share learnings and innovations so that we can improve surveillance, prevention, and treatment. And ensure equitable access for the poorest to all R&D breakthroughs"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "4‚É£ slow, suppress & stop transmission to reduce the burden on health facilities. This means safe #handwashing; testing, isolating cases & contact tracing, encouraging community-level physical distancing & the suspension of mass gatherings and international travel"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "3‚É£ prioritize treatment for those at highest risk of severe illness"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "2‚É£ ramp up surveillance and lab testing so that those with the virus can be identified quickly and isolated safely ‚Äì helping to break the chains of transmission"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "1‚É£ the public must be effectively prepared for the critical measures that are needed to help suppress the spread and protect vulnerable groups, like the elderly and those with underlying health conditions"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "The new Global Humanitarian Response Plan builds on that effort and sets a six-point action plan for how to prepare and respond to this #COVID19 emergency"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We‚Äôve worked with business leaders to ensure supply chains are working and bottlenecks are overcome"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We‚Äôve brought scientists together to boost funding in the R&D of diagnostics, treatments & a future vaccine. 

We‚Äôve communicated online, via the media & in person with many world leaders, to ensure that preparations are accelerated & populations are sensitized"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"I implore leaders to stand together and heed this appeal. 

Since the #COVID19 outbreak was identified, WHO and our partners have been ramping up surveillance and lab testing across low- and middle-income countries"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Despite their resilience they do need our help today and this new plan lays out what has to happen right now, in order to save lives and slow the spread of the #coronavirus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "People and communities that are already uprooted due to conflict, displacement, the climate crisis or other disease outbreaks are the ones we must urgently prioritize"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "As you know, the pandemic has accelerated over the last two weeks and while #COVID19 is a threat to people everywhere, what‚Äôs most worrying is the danger the virus poses to people already affected by crisis"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"I am pleased to join colleagues at this critical moment in the fight against the #coronavirus pandemic.  

I want to begin by reiterating the Secretary-General‚Äôs comments that now is the time for solidarity in the face of this threat to all of humanity"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
Pass the message: Five steps to kicking out #coronavirus:

https://t.co/ojGBcq9U4k

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "The rule of the game to kick #COVID19 out is solidarity"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "The world is rightly responding to #COVID19 with urgency and purpose. We call on the global community to harness that same urgency and purpose for the fight against #tuberculosis ‚Äì and for a healthier, safer, fairer world for everyone"-@DrTedros #EndTB

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Tomorrow is #WorldTBDay ‚Äì an opportunity to remind world leaders of the commitments they have made to end the suffering and death caused by this ancient and terrible disease"-@DrTedros #EndTB

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "I‚Äôd like to end by reminding everyone that although #COVID19 is dominating the world‚Äôs attention, there‚Äôs another respiratory disease that is both preventable and treatable, but which kills 1.5 million people every year. It‚Äôs #tuberculosis"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"That‚Äôs why WHO has launched the SOLIDARITY trial, to generate robust, high-quality evidence as fast as possible.
The more countries sign up to the trial & other large studies, the faster we will get results on which drugs work, & the more lives we will be able to save"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Small, observational & non-randomized studies will not give us the answers we need. Using untested üíä without the right evidence could raise false hope & even do more harm than good & cause a shortage of essential üíä that are needed to treat other diseases"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We also recognize that there is a desperate need for effective therapeutics. There is currently no treatment that has been proven to be effective against #COVID19.
It‚Äôs great to see the level of energy now being directed to research against COVID-19"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Solving this problem requires political coordination at the üåç level. I will be addressing heads of state from the G20 countries. I will be asking them to work together to increase production, avoid export bans & ensure equity of distribution on the basis of need"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Measures put in place to slow the spread of the virus may have unintended consequences by exacerbating shortages of essential protective gear, and the materials needed to make them"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"WHO has been working hard with many partners to rationalize and prioritize the use of personal protective equipment. 

Addressing the global shortage of these life-saving tools means addressing every part of the supply chain, from raw materials to finished product"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Even if we do everything else right, if we don‚Äôt prioritize protecting #healthworkers, many people will die because the health worker who could have saved their life is sick"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"#HealthWorkers can only do their jobs effectively when they can do their jobs safely. 

We continue to hear alarming reports from around the world of large numbers of infections among health workers"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO has been working with countries for years to build a network of Emergency Medical Teams for exactly this eventuality, to provide surge capacity of high-quality health professionals who can be deployed to care for patients and save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We‚Äôre also grateful that several countries have sent Emergency Medical Teams to care for patients & train #healthworkers in other countries that need support. 
This is an incredible example of international solidarity. But it‚Äôs not an accident"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We recognize that some countries are struggling with the capacity to carry out these offensive measures.
Several countries have shown that mobilizing resources internally from less-affected regions is one way to increase capacity"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "To win, we need to attack the #coronavirus with aggressive and targeted tactics ‚Äì  testing every suspected #COVID19 case, isolating and caring for every confirmed case, and tracing and quarantining every close contact"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"What matters most is what we do. You can't win a ‚öΩ game only by defending. You have to attack as well.
Asking people to #StayHome & other physical distancing measures are important to slow down the spread of the #coronavirus & buy time, but they're defensive measures"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"But we‚Äôre not prisoners to statistics. We‚Äôre not helpless bystanders. We can change the trajectory of the #COVID19 pandemic.
Numbers matter, because they‚Äôre not just numbers. They‚Äôre people, whose lives and families have been turned upside down"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"More than 300,000 cases of #COVID19 have now been reported to WHO, from almost every country in the üåç.
The pandemic is accelerating.
It took 67 days from the 1st reported case to reach the first 100K cases, 11 days for the second 100K & just 4 days for the third 100K"-@DrTedros https://t.co/XoBkVnWtLH

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Our new @WhatsApp Health Alert has now attracted 10 million users since we launched it last Friday, delivering reliable health information directly to their mobile phones. The Arabic, French and Spanish versions will launch this week"-@DrTedros 
https://t.co/Np7cx4LJ8F

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "I would also like to thank @tiktok_uk/@tiktok_us for its contribution of USD 10M dollars, and for its valuable support in helping to reach its large, young audience with reliable health information"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "To date, the #COVID19 fund has raised more than USD 70M from more than 187,000 individuals & organizations, to help #healthworkers on the front lines to do their life-saving work, treat patients & advance research for treatments & vaccines"-@DrTedros https://t.co/xgPkPdvn0r

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "I‚Äôd also like to take this opportunity to thank @FIFAcom for its generous contribution of 10 million U.S. dollars to the #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund"-@DrTedros #coronavirus https://t.co/T2cFArfneY

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "‚öΩ can reach millions of people, especially younger people, that public health officials cannot. Today it‚Äôs my great pleasure to welcome my brother Gianni Infantino, President of @FIFAcom, to talk about our joint campaign to ‚ÄúPass the message to kick out #coronavirus‚Äù-@DrTedros https://t.co/ojGBcq9U4k

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Many football ‚öΩ matches have stopped ‚Äì but our collaboration has become even more important during this difficult times. In fact, it‚Äôs given us the opportunity of working together more closely than we imagined"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Less than 6 months ago, WHO & @FIFAcom signed an agreement to work together to promote health through football. We didn‚Äôt know then what we know now ‚Äì that a new virus would emerge that would bring many parts of society to a standstill ‚Äì including the beautiful game"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "This service will provide the latest news and information on #COVID19, including details on symptoms and how to protect yourself. The Health Alert service is now available in English and will be introduced in other languages next week"-@DrTedros https://t.co/NiHHv2gzhU

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "To increase access to reliable information, WHO has worked with @WhatsApp and @Facebook to launch a new WHO Health Alert messaging service"-@DrTedros https://t.co/NiHHv2gzhU

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
Oral diseases disproportionally affect the poor and socially-disadvantaged members of society. There is a very strong and consistent association between socioeconomic status (income, occupation and educational level) and the prevalence and severity of oral diseases.
#OralHealth https://t.co/FYjvqNN6aC

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "#COVID19 is taking so much from us. But it‚Äôs also giving us something special ‚Äì the opportunity to come together as one humanity ‚Äì to work together, to learn together, to grow together"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Listen to music, read a book or play a game. 

And try not to read or watch too much news if it makes you anxious. Get your information from reliable sources once or twice a day"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "5‚É£ look after your #mentalhealth. It‚Äôs normal to feel stressed, confused & scared during a crisis. Talking to people you know and trust can help. Supporting other people in your community can help you as much as it does them. Check in on neighbours, family & friends"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"If you‚Äôre working at home, make sure you don‚Äôt sit in the same position for long periods. Get up and take a 3-minute break every 30 minutes.

We will be providing more advice on how to stay healthy at home in the coming days and weeks"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "If your local or national guidelines allow it, go outside for a walk, a run or a ride & keep a safe distance from others. If you can‚Äôt leave the house, find an exercise video online, dance to music, do some yoga, or walk up and down the stairs"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "4‚É£exercise. WHO recommends 30 minutes of physical activity a day for adults, and one hour a day for children"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus #BeActive

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"1‚É£ eat a healthy & nutritious diet, which helps your immune system to function properly.

2‚É£ limit your alcohol consumption & avoid sugary drinks. 

3‚É£ don‚Äôt smoke. Smoking can increase your risk of developing severe disease if you become infected with #COVID19"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "During this difficult time, it‚Äôs important to continue looking after your physical and mental health. This will not only help you in the long-term, it will also help you fight #COVID19 if you get it"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"But we‚Äôre not only advising countries. We also have advice for individuals around the world, especially those who are now adjusting to a new reality.

We know that for many people, life is changing dramatically"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "These guidelines provide a wealth of practical information on screening & triage, referral, staff, supplies, standard of care, community engagement & more. We encourage all countries to use these & the many other guidelines, which are all available on the WHO website"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "The guidelines detail actions all countries can take to provide care for patients, regardless of how many #COVID19 cases they have. They also outline specific actions to prepare health systems for no cases, sporadic cases, clusters of cases, and community transmission"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO has published guidelines for health ministers, health system administrators & other decision-makers, to help them provide life-saving treatment as health systems are challenged, without compromising the safety of #healthworkers"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "In addition to increasing access to masks, gloves, gowns and tests, we‚Äôre also increasing access to the evidence-based technical guidance countries and health workers need to save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We‚Äôre also encouraged that countries around the world continue to support the global response. We thank #Kuwait for its contribution of 40 million U.S. dollars"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We‚Äôre encouraged by the solidarity & generosity of business leaders to use their resources, experience & networks to improve the availability of supplies, communicate reliable information and protect their staff and customers"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We understand the heavy financial toll this #COVID19 pandemic is taking on businesses and the global economy"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We‚Äôre very grateful for the way the private sector has stepped up to lend its support to the global response.
Just in the past few days I‚Äôve spoken with the @iccwbo, with many CEOs through the @wef & with the ‚ÄúB20‚Äù group of business leaders from the @g20org countries"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We‚Äôre also working with companies to increase production of the other products needed to perform the tests, from the swabs used to take samples to the large machines needed to process them"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"So we have worked with FIND  ‚Äì the Foundation for Innovative New Diagnostics ‚Äì to contract additional labs to evaluate new diagnostics. 

In parallel, we‚Äôre working with companies to secure the supply and equitable distribution of these tests"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "To support our call to test every suspected case, we are also working hard to increase the üåç supply of diagnostic tests. There are many companies that produce diagnostic kits, but WHO can only buy or recommend kits evaluated independently, to ensure their quality"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Our aim is to build a pipeline to ensure continuity of supply, with support from our partners, govs. & the private sector. I am grateful to @JackMa & his foundation as well as @AlikoDangote for their willingness to help provide essential supplies to countries in need"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We have now identified some producers in #China who have agreed to supply WHO.
We‚Äôre currently finalizing the arrangements and coordinating shipments so we can refill our warehouse to ship personal protective equipment to whoever needs it most"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"The collapse of the market for personal protective equipment has created extreme difficulties in ensuring #healthworkers have access to the equipment they need to do their jobs safely & effectively.
This is an area of key concern for us"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO is working actively to support all countries, and especially those that need our support the most"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We know that if this disease takes hold in these countries, there could be significant sickness and loss of life.

But that is not inevitable. Unlike any pandemic in history, we have the power to change the way this goes"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We‚Äôve said from the beginning that our greatest concern is the impact the #coronavirus could have if it gains a foothold in countries with weaker health systems, or with vulnerable populations.
That concern has now become very real and urgent"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"I‚Äôm grateful that so many young people are spreading the word & not the virus. Solidarity is the key to defeating #COVID19 - solidarity between countries, but also between age groups.
Thank you for heeding our call for solidarity, solidarity, solidarity"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Today, I have a message for young people: you are not invincible. This #coronavirus could put you in hospital for weeks, or even kill you.
Even if you don‚Äôt get sick, the choices you make about where you go could be the difference between life & death for someone else"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Data from many countries clearly show that people under 50 make up a significant proportion of patients requiring hospitalization"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Every day, we are learning more about this #coronavirus & the disease it causes.

One of the things we are learning is that although older people are the hardest hit, younger people are not spared"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Of course, we must exercise caution ‚Äì the situation can reverse. But the experience of cities and countries that have pushed back this #coronavirus give hope and courage to the rest of the world"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Yesterday, Wuhan, üá®üá≥ reported no new cases for the first time since the #COVID19 outbreak started. 

Wuhan provides hope for the rest of the world, that even the most severe situation can be turned around"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Every loss of life is a tragedy. It‚Äôs also motivation to double down and do everything we can to stop transmission and save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Every day, #COVID19 seems to reach a new and tragic milestone. 

More than 210,000 cases have now been reported to WHO, and more than 9,000 people have lost their lives"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: Here are few photos from today's media briefing on #COVID19. https://t.co/b4obWFehRt

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros üëá https://t.co/vfqojkRzkA

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"These and other efforts give me hope that together, we can and will prevail.

This #coronavirus is presenting us with an unprecedented threat. But it‚Äôs also an unprecedented opportunity to come together as one against a common enemy"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"I continue to be inspired by the many demonstrations of solidarity from all over the üåç.
The #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund has now raised over $43M from more than 173K individuals & organizations. I‚Äôd especially like to thank @FIFAcom for its contribution of $10M"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Many countries have already confirmed that they will join the SOLIDARITY trial - Argentina, Bahrain, Canada, France, Iran, Norway, South Africa, Spain, Switzerland and Thailand - and I trust many more will join"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "The SOLIDARITY trial provides simplified procedures to enable even hospitals that have been overloaded to participate"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"This large, international study is designed to generate the robust data we need, to show which treatments are the most effective. 

We have called this study the SOLIDARITY trial"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Multiple small trials with different methods may not give us the clear, strong evidence we need about which treatments help to save lives.
WHO & partners are organizing a study in many countries in which some of these untested treatments are compared with each other"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"The first vaccine trial has begun, just 60 days after the genetic sequence of the #coronavirus was shared. This is an incredible achievement.
We commend the researchers around the world who have come together to systemically evaluate experimental therapeutics"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"WHO continues to call on all countries to implement a comprehensive approach, with the aim of slowing down #COVID19 transmission and flattening the curve. 

This approach is saving lives and buying time for the development of vaccines and treatments"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"If health facilities are at risk of being overwhelmed, people with mild #COVID19 disease can be cared for at home.

Although this is not the ideal situation, WHO has advice on our website for how home-care can be provided as safely as possible"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "If that‚Äôs not possible, countries can use community facilities to isolate & care for mild #COVID19 cases & refer them for specialized care quickly if needed"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Likewise, WHO continues to recommend that, wherever possible, confirmed mild #COVID19 cases should be isolated in health facilities, where trained professionals can provide good medical care, and prevent clinical progression and onward transmission"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO is working in solidarity with other countries with #COVID19 community transmission to apply the lessons learned in üá∞üá∑ and elsewhere, and adapt them to the local context"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "At the peak in üá∞üá∑ there were more than 800 #COVID19 cases and yesterday there were only 90 cases"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"...
[üá∞üá∑] It did exhaustive contact tracing and testing in selected areas
And it isolated suspected cases in designated facilities rather than hospitals or at home.

As a result, #COVID19 cases have been declining for weeks"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"A month ago, üá∞üá∑ was faced with accelerating #COVID19 community transmission. But it didn‚Äôt surrender.
It educated, empowered & engaged communities
It developed an innovative testing strategy & expanded lab capacity
It rationed the use of masks
..."-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"But we know that some countries are experiencing intense epidemics with extensive #COVID19 community transmission.

We understand the effort required to suppress transmission in these situations. But it can be done"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Many countries are listening to our call & finding solutions to increase their ability to implement the full package of measures that have turned the tide in several countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO continues to recommend that isolating, testing and treating every suspected #COVID19 case, and tracing every contact, must be the backbone of the response in every country. This is the best hope of preventing widespread community transmission"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"But to suppress and control epidemics, countries must isolate, test, treat and trace.

If they don‚Äôt, transmission chains can continue at a low level, then resurge once physical distancing measures are lifted"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Physical distancing measures like cancelling sporting events, concerts & other large gatherings can:
-help to slow the #coronavirus transmission
-reduce the burden on the health system
-help to make epidemics manageable, allowing targeted and focused measures"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Don‚Äôt assume your community won‚Äôt be affected. Prepare as if it will be.

Don‚Äôt assume you won‚Äôt be infected. Prepare as if you will be.

But there is hope. There are many things all countries can do"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Every day, WHO is talking to ministers of health, heads of state, #healthworkers, hospital managers, industry leaders, CEOs and more ‚Äì to help them prepare and prioritize, according to their specific situation"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We understand that different countries and communities are in different situations, with different levels of #COVID19 transmission"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We know that many countries now face escalating epidemics & are feeling overwhelmed.

We hear you. We know the tremendous difficulties you face & the enormous burden you‚Äôre under. We understand the heart-wrenching choices you are having to make"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"That same spirit of solidarity must be at the centre of our efforts to defeat #COVID19.

More than 200,000 cases have been reported to WHO & more than 8000 people have lost their lives.

More than 80% of all cases are from two regions ‚Äì the @WHOWPRO & @WHO_Europe"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"It‚Äôs now more than a month since the last case of #Ebola in #DRC. If it stays that way, the outbreak will be declared over in less than a month‚Äôs time.

We‚Äôd like to thank all our partners for their solidarity in staying the course in the service of the people of üá®üá©"-@DrTedros

We must protect vulnerable populations, incl. children, from infection by aggressive efforts to reduce transmission. This includes test all suspect cases, isolate & care for cases and quarantine contacts.

#coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
Clarification: Children & young adults have been infected w/ #COVID19, though at lower rates than older adults. 
While the vast majority have experienced mild disease, some have experienced severe or critical disease & some young adults & one child, that we are aware of, has died

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros üëáhttps://t.co/4piczzrmpf

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We‚Äôre all in this together. And we can only succeed together"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "This amazing spirit of human solidarity must become even more infectious than the #coronavirus itself. Although we may have to be physically apart from each other for a while, we can come together in ways we never have before"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Like me, I‚Äôm sure you have been touched by the videos of people applauding #healthworkers from their balconies, or the stories of people offering to do grocery shopping for older people in their community"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus https://t.co/KGpkz6i4VN

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"This is the defining global health crisis of our time. 

The days, weeks and months ahead will be a test of our resolve, a test of our trust in science, and a test of solidarity.

Crises like #COVID19 tend to bring out the best and worst in humanity"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO & @iccwbo issued a joint call to action to the global business community. The ICC will send regular advice to its network of 45M+ businesses, to protect their workers, customers & local communities, & to support the production & distribution of essential supplies"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We‚Äôre also grateful for the way different sectors of society are coming together. 

This started with the #SafeHands Challenge, which has attracted celebrities, world leaders and people everywhere demonstrating how to wash their hands"-@DrTedros #COVID19 https://t.co/HOAzLbZomA

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"These funds will help to buy diagnostic tests, supplies for health workers and support research and development.

If you would like to contribute, please go to https://t.co/RYxMne1R3f and click on the orange ‚ÄúDonate‚Äù button at the top of the page"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus https://t.co/a5Cz8azq8g

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We‚Äôre grateful to everyone who has contributed to the #COVID19 Solidarity Response Fund. 

Since we launched it on Friday, more than 110,000 people have contributed almost 19 million U.S. dollars"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We also ask people to express their solidarity by refraining from hoarding essential items, including medicines.

Hoarding can create shortages of medicines and other essential products, which can exacerbate suffering"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Washing your hands will help to reduce your risk of #coronavirus infection. But it‚Äôs also an act of solidarity because it reduces the risk you will infect others in your community and around the world. Do it for yourself, do it for others"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "As the #coronavirus moves to low-income countries, we're deeply concerned about the impact it could have among populations with high HIV prevalence or malnourished children. We‚Äôre calling on every country & individual to do everything they can to stop transmission"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"WHO has issued new clinical guidance, with specific details on how to care for children, older people and pregnant women.

So far, we have seen epidemics in countries with advanced health systems. But even they have struggled to cope"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Once again, our key message is: 
test,
test,
test.

This is a serious disease. Although the evidence we have suggests that those over 60 are at highest risk, young people, including children, have died"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"People infected with #COVID19 can still infect others after they stop feeling sick, so these measures should continue for at least 2 weeks after symptoms disappear.

Visitors should not be allowed until the end of this period.

There are more details in WHO‚Äôs guidance"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Assign one person to care for the #COVID19 patient, ideally someone who is in good health and has no underlying conditions.

The care-giver should wash their hands after any contact with the patient or their immediate environment"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"For example, both the #COVID19 patient & their care-giver should wear a medical mask when they are together in the same room.

The patient should sleep in a separate bedroom to others and use a different bathroom"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Another option is for patients with mild #COVID19 to be isolated & cared for at home.

Caring for infected people at home may put others in the same household at risk, so it‚Äôs critical that care-givers follow WHO‚Äôs guidance on how to provide care as safely as possible"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"In that situation, countries should prioritize older patients & those with underlying conditions.
Some countries have expanded their capacity by using stadiums & gyms to care for mild #COVID19 cases, with severe & critical cases cared for in hospitals"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"WHO advises that all confirmed #COVID19 cases, even mild cases, should be isolated in health facilities, to prevent transmission & provide adequate care.
But we recognize that many countries have already exceeded their capacity to care for mild cases in dedicated üè•"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Every day, more tests are being produced to meet the global demand. 

WHO has shipped almost 1.5 million tests to 120 countries. We‚Äôre working with companies to increase the availability of tests for those most in need"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We have a simple message for all countries:
test
test
test.

Test every suspected #COVID19 case. 

If they test positive, isolate them & find out who they have been in close contact with up to 2 days before they developed symptoms & test those people too"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"But the most effective way to prevent infections & save lives is breaking the chains of #COVID19 transmission. To do that, you must test & isolate. 

You cannot fight a fire blindfolded. And we cannot stop this pandemic if we don‚Äôt know who is infected"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "But on their own, they aren't enough to extinguish this #COVID19 pandemic. It‚Äôs the combination that makes the difference. As I keep saying, all countries must take a comprehensive approach"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Social distancing measures can help to reduce #COVID19 transmission and enable health systems to cope.

Handwashing and coughing into your elbow can reduce the risk for yourself and others"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We have seen a rapid escalation in social distancing measures, like closing schools & cancelling sporting events & other gatherings. But we haven't seen an urgent enough escalation in testing, isolation & contact tracing, which is the backbone of the #COVID19 response"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "In the past week, we have seen a rapid escalation of cases of #COVID19. More cases and deaths have now been reported in the rest of the world than in #China"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Cover your mouth & nose with your elbow if you cough or sneeze. 

Stay home if you‚Äôre sick.

Avoid unnecessary travel & large social gatherings.

Comply with the advice of your local / national health authority.

Find & share reliable information"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"There are simple, effective things we can all do to reduce the risk of infection for ourselves & those around us.

Clean your hands regularly with an alcohol-based rub or soap and water"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus 

https://t.co/gb4nZhdoMb

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"And fourth, innovate and learn.

This is a new virus and a new situation. We‚Äôre all learning and we must all find new ways to prevent infections, save lives, and minimize impact. All countries have lessons to share"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Even if you cannot stop #COVID19 transmission, you can slow it down and save lives"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Third, reduce #COVID19 transmission.

Do not just let this fire burn.

Isolate the sick & quarantine their contacts.
Measures that increase social distancing may help reduce transmission. These measures should be based on local context & risk assessment & time-limited-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Second, detect, protect and treat.

You can‚Äôt fight a virus if you don‚Äôt know where it is. Find, isolate, test and treat every case, to break the chains of #COVID19 transmission.

Every case we find and treat limits the expansion of the disease"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Every #healthworker should be able to recognize #COVID19, provide care and know what to do with their patients. 

Every health facility should be ready to cope with large numbers of patients, and ensure the safety of staff and patients"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"WHO has clear advice for governments, businesses and individuals.

First, prepare and be ready.

Every person must know the signs and symptoms of #COVID19 and how to protect themselves and others"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "#Japan is also demonstrating that a whole-of-government approach led by Prime Minister @AbeShinzo himself, supported by in-depth investigation of clusters, is a critical step in reducing #COVID19 transmission"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "The experience of üá®üá≥, üá∞üá∑, üá∏üá¨ and others clearly demonstrates that aggressive testing and contact tracing, combined with social distancing measures and community mobilization, can prevent #COVID19 infections and save lives"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Any country that looks at the experience of other countries with large epidemics and thinks ‚Äúthat won‚Äôt happen to us‚Äù is making a deadly mistake. It can happen to anyone"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Our message to countries continues to be: you must take a comprehensive approach. 

Not testing alone. Not contact tracing alone. Not quarantine alone. Not social distancing alone. Do it all"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We‚Äôre continuing to support countries to prepare and respond.
We have shipped supplies of personal protective equipment to 56 countries, we‚Äôre shipping to a further 28, and we‚Äôve sent almost 1.5 million diagnostic tests to 120 countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO has evidence-based guidance that every country can use, according to each of the 8 pillars"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We‚Äôre encouraged that many countries are now acting on the 8 pillars of WHO‚Äôs #COVID19 Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan. 

Most countries now have a national plan; most are taking a multi-sectoral approach and most have laboratory testing capacity"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Europe has now become the epicenter of the #COVID19 pandemic, with more reported cases and deaths than the rest of the world combined, apart from #China.

More cases are now being reported every day than were reported in üá®üá≥ at the height of its epidemic"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"More than 132,000 cases of #COVID19 have now been reported to WHO, from 123 countries and territories.

5,000 people have lost their lives, a tragic milestone"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"#HealthWorkers do a heroic job. We know that #COVID19 crisis is putting a huge burden on you & your families. We know you are stretched to the limit.
You have our admiration, respect & commitment to doing everything we can to keep you safe & enable you to do your job"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"For all of these, we need #healthworkers. 
I want to send a personal & sincere thank you to every health worker around the üåç ‚Äì especially nurses & midwives, who we are celebrating this year through the Intl. Year of the Nurse & the Midwife"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Babies are still being born. Essential surgery is continuing. People still need emergency care after road traffic crashes. People still need treatment for cancer, diabetes, HIV, malaria and many other diseases"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "I want to start today by acknowledging that even though #COVID19 has captured the world‚Äôs attention, there are still many other health issues people continue to face every single day, and that WHO is continuing to work on"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros üëâ https://t.co/dRwxvdxILJ https://t.co/n3KVBggZXD

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We‚Äôre in this together, to do the right things with calm and protect the citizens of the world. It‚Äôs doable"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"There‚Äôs been so much attention on one word. 

Let me give you some other words that matter much more, & that are much more actionable:

Prevention.

Preparedness.

Public health.

Political leadership.

And most of all, People"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"I remind all countries that we are calling on you to (2):
-ready your hospitals
-protect and train your #healthworkers
-let‚Äôs all look out for each other"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"I remind all countries that we are calling on you to (1):
-activate & scale up your emergency response mechanisms
-communicate with your people about the risks & how they can protect themselves
-find, isolate, test & treat every #COVID19 case & trace every contact"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Let me summarize it in 4‚É£ key areas.

1‚É£ Prepare and be ready.

2‚É£ Detect, protect and treat.

3‚É£ Reduce transmission.

4‚É£ Innovate and learn"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "I have said from the beginning that countries must take a whole-of-government, whole-of-society approach, built around a comprehensive strategy to prevent infections, save lives and minimize impact"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "This is not just a public health crisis, it is a crisis that will touch every sector ‚Äì so every sector and every individual must be involved in the fight"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO‚Äôs mandate is public health. But we‚Äôre working with many partners across all sectors to mitigate the social and economic consequences of this #COVID19 pandemic"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "All countries must strike a fine balance between protecting health, minimizing economic & social disruption & respecting human rights"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We are grateful for the measures being taken in üáÆüá∑, üáÆüáπ and üá∞üá∑ to slow the virus and control their #COVID19 epidemics. 

We know that these measures are taking a heavy toll on societies and economies, just as they did in üá®üá≥"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
‚ÄúSome countries are struggling with a lack of capacity.
 
Some countries are struggling with a lack of resources.
 
Some countries are struggling with a lack of resolve.‚Äù-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: ‚ÄúThe challenge for many countries who are now dealing with large #COVID19 clusters or community transmission is not whether they can do the same ‚Äì it‚Äôs whether they will‚Äù-@DrTedros #Coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
‚ÄúEven those countries with community transmission or large clusters can turn the tide on this #coronavirus.
 
Several countries have demonstrated that this virus can be suppressed and controlled.‚Äù-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "If countries detect, test, treat, isolate, trace, and mobilize their people in the response, those with a handful of #COVID19 cases can prevent those cases becoming clusters, and those clusters becoming community transmission"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"81 countries have not reported any #COVID19 cases, and 57 countries have reported 10 cases or less.

We cannot say this loudly enough, or clearly enough, or often enough: all countries can still change the course of this pandemic"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Of the 118,000 #COVID19 cases reported globally in 114 countries, more than 90 percent of cases are in just four countries, and two of those ‚Äì üá®üá≥ and üá∞üá∑ - have significantly declining epidemics"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "As I said on Monday, just looking at the number of #COVID19 cases and the number of countries affected does not tell the full story"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We have called every day for countries to take urgent and aggressive action.

We have rung the alarm bell loud and clear"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We have never before seen a pandemic sparked by a #coronavirus. 

And we have never before seen a pandemic that can be controlled at the same time. 

WHO has been in full response mode since we were notified of the first cases"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Describing the situation as a pandemic does not change WHO‚Äôs assessment of the threat posed by this #coronavirus. It doesn‚Äôt change what WHO is doing, and it doesn‚Äôt change what countries should do"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Pandemic is not a word to use lightly or carelessly. It is a word that, if misused, can cause unreasonable fear, or unjustified acceptance that the fight is over, leading to unnecessary suffering and death"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
üö® BREAKING üö®

"We have therefore made the assessment that #COVID19 can be characterized as a pandemic"-@DrTedros #coronavirus https://t.co/JqdsM2051A

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO has been assessing this outbreak around the clock and we are deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Thousands more are fighting for their lives in hospitals.

In the days and weeks ahead, we expect to see the number of #COVID19 cases, the number of deaths, and the number of affected countries climb even higher"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"In the past two weeks, the number of cases of #COVID19 outside üá®üá≥ has increased 13-fold & the number of affected countries has tripled. 

There are now more than 118,000 cases in 114 countries, & 4,291 people have lost their lives"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: Here are some photos from today's media briefing on #COVID19 https://t.co/vFudfso0jv

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros üëâ https://t.co/NqcCzdSny5 https://t.co/ebJOUui4p1

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Let hope be the antidote to fear. 

Let solidarity be the antidote to blame.

Let our shared humanity be the antidote to our shared threat"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We‚Äôre encouraged that #Italy üáÆüáπ is taking aggressive measures to contain its #COVID19 epidemic, and we hope that those measures prove effective in the coming days"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"The rule of the game is: never give up.

But that can only be achieved with aggressive action, as early as possible. Half-hearted measures will leave the door ajar for the #coronavirus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Of the 4 countries with the most cases, üá®üá≥ is bringing its #COVID19 epidemic under control & there is now a decline in new cases being reported from üá∞üá∑.

Both these countries demonstrate that it‚Äôs never too late to turn back the tide on this #coronavirus"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "As long as that‚Äôs the case, those countries have the opportunity to break the chains of #COVID19 transmission, prevent community transmission and reduce the burden on their health systems"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"For the moment, only a handful of countries have signs of sustained community transmission.

Most countries still have sporadic #COVID19 cases or defined clusters. We must all take heart from that"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Almost USD300 million has now been pledged to WHO‚Äôs Strategic Preparedness & Response Plan. 

We are encouraged by these signs of global solidarity. We continue to call on all countries to take early & aggressive action to protect their people & save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "More funds are being made available for the #COVID19 response, and we‚Äôre very grateful to all countries & partners who have contributed. Just since Friday, üá¶üáø üá®üá≥üá∞üá∑ & üá∏üá¶ have announced contributions"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre also working with our colleagues across the @UN system to support countries to develop their #COVID19 preparedness & response plans, according to the 8 pillars.
 
We have set up a partners platform to match country needs with contributions from donors.‚Äù-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve shipped supplies of personal protective equipment to 57 countries, we‚Äôre preparing to ship to a further 28, and we‚Äôve shipped lab supplies to 120 countries.‚Äù-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
‚ÄúFurther details on specific actions countries should take in specific contexts are available on WHO‚Äôs website https://t.co/G4rruQuI4r 
 
WHO is continuing to support countries in all four scenarios.‚Äù-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
‚ÄúNigeria üá≥üá¨, Senegal üá∏üá≥ and Ethiopia üá™üáπ have strengthened #COVID19 surveillance and diagnostic capacity to find cases quickly‚Äù-@DrTedros #coronavirus

https://t.co/IVqVc0uc7X

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
‚Äúüá∞üá∑ have increased efforts to identify all #COVID19 cases and contacts, including drive-through temperature testing to widen the net and catch cases that might otherwise be missed‚Äù-@DrTedros #coronavirus 

https://t.co/eZIuaMADWw

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"üá∏üá¨ is a good example of an all of government approach ‚Äì Prime Minister @leehsienloong‚Äôs regular videos are helping to explain the #coronavirus risks & reassure people"-@DrTedros #COVID19 

https://t.co/m6gAqZcUQJ

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"There are many examples of countries demonstrating that these measures work.

üá®üá≥ üáÆüáπ üáØüáµ üá∞üá∑ üá∫üá∏ & many others have activated #COVID19 emergency measures"-@DrTedros #coronavirus 

https://t.co/4le6L2YZ9J

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"The fundamental elements of the #COVID19 response are the same for all countries:
5‚É£Laboratory testing
6‚É£Treating patients & hospital readiness
7‚É£Infection prevention & control
8‚É£All-of-society & all-of-government approach"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"The fundamental elements of the #COVID19 response are the same for all countries:
1‚É£Emergency response mechanisms
2‚É£Risk comms & public engagement
3‚É£Case finding & contact tracing
4‚É£Public health measures"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Depending on their context, countries with #COVID19 community transmission could consider closing schools, cancelling mass gatherings and other measures to reduce exposure"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "In areas with community spread, testing every suspected #COVID19 case and tracing their contacts becomes more challenging. Action must be taken to prevent transmission at the community level to reduce the epidemic to manageable clusters"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "For the first three categories, countries must focus on finding, testing, treating and isolating individual #COVID19 cases, and following their contacts"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"WHO has consolidated our guidance for countries in 4 categories:
-with no #COVID19 cases
-with sporadic cases
-with clusters
-with community transmission.

For all countries, the aim is the same: stop transmission & prevent the spread of the #coronavirus"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Countries that continue finding and testing #COVID19 cases and tracing their contacts not only protect their own people, they can also affect what happens in other countries and globally"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "All countries must take a comprehensive blended strategy for controlling their #COVID19 epidemics & pushing this #coronavirus back"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"This is an uneven epidemic at the global level.

Different countries are in different scenarios, requiring a tailored response.

It‚Äôs not about containment or mitigation ‚Äì which is a false dichotomy. It‚Äôs about both"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"It‚Äôs also important to remember that looking only at the total number of reported #COVID19 cases & the total number of countries doesn‚Äôt tell the full story. 

Of all the cases reported globally so far, 93% are from just four countries"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We need to remember that with decisive, early action, we can slow down the #coronavirus and prevent infections. Among those who are infected, most will recover.

Of the 80,000 reported #COVID19 cases in #China, more than 70% have recovered and been discharged"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "The great advantage we have is that the decisions we all make ‚Äì as governments, businesses, communities, families & individuals ‚Äì can influence the trajectory of this #COVID19 epidemic"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Now that the #coronavirus has a foothold in so many countries, the threat of a pandemic has become very real.

But it would be the first pandemic in history that could be controlled.

The bottom line is: we are not at the mercy of this virus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Over the weekend we crossed 100,000 reported cases of #COVID19 in 100 countries.

It‚Äôs certainly troubling that so many people & countries have been affected, so quickly"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"The #Ebola outbreak in #DRC may be ending ‚Äì but our determination is not. 

And nor is our commitment to combating the #COVID19 epidemic"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We continue to investigate alerts & vaccinate contacts every day & the security situation in remains fragile.
In previous #Ebola outbreaks we have seen flare-ups even after the end of the outbreak, so we are continuing to provide follow-up care for over 1100 survivors"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "I‚Äôd like to start with a brief update on the #Ebola epidemic in #DRC. It‚Äôs now three weeks since the last case was reported, and a week since the last survivor left the treatment centre. We are now in the countdown to the end of the outbreak"-@DrTedros
