name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros üëá
https://t.co/1pNkytELhe

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"As I keep saying, we‚Äôre all in this together, and we all have a role to play.

Facts not fear.

Reason not rumours.

Solidarity not stigma"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO is working with the @wef to engage companies around the world, and earlier this week I spoke to more than 200 CEOs about how they can protect their staff and customers, ensure business continuity and contribute to the response"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"You‚Äôve heard me talk about:
-the market failure for personal protective equipment
-the need for a whole-of-government approach
-what individuals can do to protect themselves & others. 

We look forward to businesses to step up and play their part. We need you"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "All of this requires the involvement of the private sector to ensure countries can access life-saving products"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We encourage every country to review WHO‚Äôs disease commodity package for #COVID19 to ensure it has the supplies it needs, incl protective equipment & medical devices"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO has an existing working group with the @gatesfoundation, the @ClintonHealth and @PATHtweets, and we are building on that partnership to increase access to oxygen"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Access to medical oxygen could be the difference between life and death for some patients, but there is already a shortage in many countries, which could be exacerbated by this #COVID19 epidemic"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO has developed a list of over 20 essential medical devices that countries need to manage #COVID19 patients, incl ventilators and oxygen supply systems"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Many manufacturers either have alternative sources of ingredients, or had stocks to draw on. Manufacturing has now resumed in most places in #China, although some challenges remain"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO is working closely with industry associations, regulators & other partners to monitor this risk, and so far we have not identified any imminent specific shortages"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"üá®üá≥ is a major producer of active pharmaceutical ingredients & the intermediate products that are used to produce üíä in other countries.
WHO has focused on the most essential üíä that are critical for #PrimaryHealthCare & emergencies"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Even as we test therapeutics, we need to ensure that supplies of those medicines are available should they prove effective.
WHO has been monitoring the potential risk of a disruption to medicines supplies as a result of the #COVID19 epidemic"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "So far WHO has received applications for review & approval of 40 diagnostic tests, 20 vaccines are in development & many clinical trials of therapeutics are underway"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We‚Äôre also developing research protocols to assess interventions for disenfranchised communities such as refugees & internally displaced persons.
We‚Äôre very encouraged by the level of interest around the world in accelerating research as part of the response"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "WHO has developed a set of core protocols that outline standards for how studies should be done & to collect critical data so we can compare apples with apples & pool data from multiple studies"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "It‚Äôs vital to coordinate research so that different groups around the world complement each other, so WHO can give better advice, and countries can take evidence-based decisions that save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"These incl the natural history of the #coronavirus, epidemiology, vaccines, diagnostics, therapeutics, clinical management, ethical considerations, social sciences.
The R&D roadmap focuses on research that can save lives now, as well as longer-term research priorities"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Last month WHO convened a meeting of over 400 scientists to identify #COVID19 research priorities.
Hundreds of ideas were discussed & debated & today we are publishing an R&D roadmap which distills those ideas into a core group of priorities in 9 key areas"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Every day we slow down the #COVID19 epidemic is another day:
-governments can prepare their #healthworkers to detect, test, treat & care for patients. 
-closer to having vaccines & therapeutics, which can in turn prevent infections & save lives"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Slowing down the #COVID19 epidemic saves lives, and it buys time for preparedness and for research and development.

Every day we can slow down the epidemic is another day hospitals can prepare themselves for cases"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"As #COVID19 cases increase, we are continuing to recommend that all countries make containment their highest priority.

We continue to call on countries to find, test, isolate and care for every case, and to trace every contact"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"In the past 24h, 2736 cases of #COVID19 were reported from 47 countries & territories.

There is now a total of 98,023 reported cases globally & 3380 deaths.

We are now on the verge of reaching 100,000 confirmed cases"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Women are also playing a vital role in the response to #COVID19, and we‚Äôre proud to have many amazing women leading our response, including @mvankerkhove, @SCBriand, @doctorsoumya, Ana Maria, Mari√¢ngela, Marie Pierre, Adriana, @gabbystern & many others"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"WHO is committed to promoting gender equality everywhere & especially in the health workforce.

We‚Äôre proud that we have achieved gender equality in our senior leadership team at WHO HQ, although we know we still have work to do in other parts of the Organization"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"#InternationalWomensDay is an opportunity not only to promote & protect the health of women, but to highlight the vital role they play in promoting & protecting the health of all people.
Women make up 70% of the üåç health workforce, but hold only 25% of senior roles"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"I would like to start by acknowledging #InternationalWomensDay this Sunday. 
This is a moment to remember that around the world, many women cannot access essential health services & continue to suffer disproportionately from preventable & treatable diseases"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros üëá https://t.co/yWlvMw7P5R

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"There‚Äôs something all of us can do to protect vulnerable people in our communities.

That‚Äôs why we keep talking about solidarity.

This is not just a threat for individual people, or individual countries.

We‚Äôre all in this together & we can only save lives together"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"#COVID19 is a serious disease. It is not deadly to most people, but it can kill. 

We‚Äôre all responsible for reducing our own risk of infection, and if we‚Äôre infected, for reducing our risk of infecting others."-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"There‚Äôs still a lot we don‚Äôt know, but every day we‚Äôre learning more & we‚Äôre working around the clock to fill in the gaps in our knowledge. 

Ultimately, how deadly this #coronavirus will be depends not only on the virus itself, but on how we respond to it"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "If you feel overwhelmed by fear, reach out to those around you. Find out what your community‚Äôs emergency response plans are, how you fit in and how you can help"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus https://t.co/OnFk3fEAFV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We know people are afraid & that‚Äôs normal & appropriate.
That fear can be managed & moderated with accurate information.
WHO has launched a new social media campaign called Be Ready for #COVID19, which urges people to be safe, smart & informed"-@DrTedros 
https://t.co/Ms4B1Yd4d2

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Although #COVID19 presents an acute threat now, it is absolutely essential that countries do not lose this opportunity to strengthen their preparedness systems"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"This is funding that is available now to countries who need it, in line with WHO‚Äôs Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan.

These funds are essential for supporting the #COVID19 response now, but also for long-term preparedness"-@DrTedros https://t.co/fFD0FCe1r3

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "The @WorldBank & the International Monetary Fund have both made funds available to stabilize health systems & mitigate the economic consequences of the #COVID19 epidemic, with a special focus on enabling access to critical supplies and equipment"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "More funding is being made available to support countries that need it & that have plans in place"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
‚ÄúWHO has published step-by-step guidelines for countries to develop their natl action plans according to 8 key areas, which are supported by detailed technical guidance.
We call on all countries to accelerate those plans & stand ready to work with them to do that‚Äù-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
‚ÄúIf we take the approach that there‚Äôs nothing we can do, that will quickly become a self-fulfilling prophecy.
 
It‚Äôs in our hands.‚Äù-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
‚ÄúTrain your #healthworkers to identify #COVID19 cases, provide careful & compassionate treatment & protect themselves from infection.
If countries act aggressively to find, isolate, treat cases & trace every contact, they can change the trajectory of this epidemic‚Äù-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
‚Äú-Activate your emergency plans.
-Educate your public, so that people know what the #COVID19 symptoms are & know how to protect themselves and others.
-Increase your testing capacity.
-Get your hospitals ready.
-Ensure essential supplies are available.‚Äù-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
‚ÄúThese are plans that start with leadership from the top, coordinating every part of government, not just the health ministry ‚Äì security, diplomacy, finance, commerce, transport, trade, information and more.‚Äù-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus 

https://t.co/Z632NPiz4v

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"This is not a drill. 

This is not the time to give up.

This is not a time for excuses.

This is a time for pulling out all the stops.

Countries have been planning for scenarios like this for decades. Now is the time to act on those plans"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We are concerned that in some countries the level of political commitment and the actions that demonstrate that commitment do not match the level of the threat we all face"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"This #COVID19 epidemic is a threat for every country, rich & poor.

We‚Äôre concerned that some countries have either not taken this seriously enough, or have decided there is nothing they can do"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We are calling on every country to act with speed, scale & clear-minded determination.

Although we continue to see the majority of #COVID19 cases in a handful of countries, we are deeply concerned about the increasing number of countries reporting cases"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"The experience of these countries & of #China continues to demonstrate that this is not a one-way street.

This #COVID19 epidemic can be pushed back, but only with a collective, coordinated & comprehensive approach that engages the entire machinery of government"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Although a few countries are reporting large numbers of #COVID19 cases, 115 countries have not reported any cases. 

21 countries have reported only one case.

5 countries that had reported cases have not reported new cases in the past 14 days"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "We see encouraging signs from üá∞üá∑. The number of newly-reported #COVID19 cases appears to be declining & the cases that are being reported are being identified primarily from known clusters"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Outside üá®üá≥, 2055 #COVID19 cases were reported in 33 countries. Around 80% of those cases continue to come from just three countries"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"There is now a total of 95,265 reported cases of #COVID19 globally & 3281 deaths.

In the past 24 hours, #China reported 143 cases. Most cases continue to be reported from Hubei province, and 8 provinces have not reported any cases in the last 14 days"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "The fight against rumours and misinformation is a vital part of the battle against this #coronavirus. We rely on you to make sure people have accurate information about the threat they face, and how to protect themselves and others"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #KnowTheFacts

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Today I want to start by saying thank you to our colleagues in the media. As providers of information, you play a vital role in the response to #COVID19"-@DrTedros #coronavirus #KnowTheFacts

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Once again, this is a question of solidarity. This cannot be solved by WHO alone, or one industry alone. It requires all of us working together to ensure all countries can protect the people who protect the rest of us"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We have called on governments to develop incentives for manufacturers to ramp up production. This includes easing restrictions on the export & distribution of personal protective equipment & other medical supplies"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We continue to call on manufacturers to urgently increase production to meet this demand & guarantee supplies"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We‚Äôre working with governments, manufacturers & the Pandemic Supply Chain Network to boost production & secure supplies for critically affected & at-risk countries.
üåç, it is estimated that personal protective equipment supplies need to be increased by 40%"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "WHO estimates that each month 89m medical masks will be required for the #COVID19 response; 76m examination gloves & 1.6m goggles.
WHO has guidelines on how to rationalize the use of personal protective equipment in health facilities & manage supply chains effectively"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Supplies can take months to deliver, market manipulation is widespread & stocks are often sold to the highest bidder.

WHO has shipped nearly half a million sets of personal protective equipment to 27 countries, but supplies are rapidly depleting"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We can‚Äôt stop #COVID19 without protecting #healthworkers.
Prices of surgical masks have increased six-fold, N95 respirators have more than trebled & gowns cost twice as much"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Shortages are leaving doctors, nurses & other frontline #healthworkers dangerously ill-equipped to care for #COVID19 patients, due to limited access to supplies such as gloves, medical masks, respirators, goggles, face shields, gowns & aprons"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We are concerned that countries‚Äô abilities to respond are being compromised by the severe & increasing disruption to the global supply of personal protective equipment ‚Äì caused by rising demand, hoarding & misuse"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Because #COVID19 is also a respiratory pathogen, those systems can, should and are being adapted for COVID-19"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "These differences mean we can‚Äôt treat #COVID19 exactly the same way we treat flu. But there are enough similarities to mean that countries are not starting from scratch. For decades, many countries have invested in building up their systems to detect & respond to flu"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Fourth, we don‚Äôt even talk about containment for seasonal flu ‚Äì it‚Äôs just not possible. But it is possible for #COVID19. We don‚Äôt bother with contact tracing for seasonal flu ‚Äì but countries should do it for COVID-19, because it will prevent infections & save lives"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Third, we have vaccines & therapeutics for seasonal flu, but at the moment there is no vaccine & no specific treatment for #COVID19. However, clinical trials of therapeutics are now being done & more than 20 vaccines are in development"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Globally, about 3.4% of reported #COVID19 cases have died. By comparison, seasonal flu generally kills far fewer than 1% of those infected"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros The second major difference is that #COVID19 causes more severe disease than seasonal influenza.

While many people globally have built up immunity to seasonal flu strains, COVID-19 is a new #coronavirus to which no one has immunity"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "WHO has developed protocols on how these studies should be done, and we encourage all countries to do these studies and share their data"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "The only way to be sure is by looking for #COVID19 antibodies in large numbers of people, and several countries are now doing those studies. This will give us further insight into the extent of infection in populations over time"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Countries such as üá®üá≥, üá¨üá≠, üá∏üá¨ & elsewhere have found very few cases of #COVID19 among such samples ‚Äì or no cases at all"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Evidence from üá®üá≥ is that only 1% of reported #COVID19 cases do not have symptoms & most of those cases develop symptoms within 2 days.

Some countries are looking for cases of COVID-19 using surveillance systems for influenza & other respiratory diseases"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "This #coronavirus is not SARS, it‚Äôs not MERS & it‚Äôs not influenza. It is a unique virus with unique characteristics.

Both #COVID19 & influenza cause respiratory disease & spread the same way, via small droplets of fluid from the nose & mouth of someone who is sick"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We understand that people are afraid & uncertain. Fear is a natural human response to any threat, esp. when it‚Äôs a threat we don‚Äôt completely understand.
But as we get more data, we are understanding this #coronavirus & the disease it causes, more & more"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "The actions these newly-affected countries take today will be the difference between a handful of cases and a larger cluster"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We have now had 2 weeks without a single reported case of #Ebola in üá®üá© & there are currently no patients receiving treatment. This is very good news for the whole üåç & especially for the thousands of #healthworkers who have sacrificed so much in the fight against it"-@DrTedros

text: @DrTedros Here are some photos from today's media briefing on #COVID19 https://t.co/6gWKaxfEPI

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "WHO is advising countries on actions they can take for each of the ‚Äú3 Cs‚Äù scenarios:
-1st case
-1st cluster
-1st evidence of community transmission.
The basic actions in each scenario are the same, but the emphasis changes depending on which scenario a country is in"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "For example, #China had community transmission in Wuhan, but relatively small numbers of cases in other provinces.

Other countries have a similar pattern"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Some have rapidly expanding epidemics, with signs of community transmission.

And some have declining epidemics, and have not reported a case for more than two weeks.

Some countries have more than one of these scenarios at the same time"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MohamedBinZayed "WHO will continue to provide evidence-based guidance to help countries and individuals to assess and manage their risk, and make decisions. 

There is no one-size fits all approach. Different countries are in different scenarios"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MohamedBinZayed "The answers to these questions will vary depending on where you live, how old you are, and how healthy you are. 

Individuals, families and communities should follow the advice provided by local health authorities and local health professionals"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MohamedBinZayed "Is the #coronavirus spreading in my community? 

Will my kids be okay?

Will my parents be okay?

Is it safe to hold an event? 

Should I travel?"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MohamedBinZayed "But we need to see this in perspective. Of the 88,913 #COVID19 cases reported üåç so far, 90% are in üá®üá≥, mostly in one province.

We know people are afraid. We know they have many concerns and questions"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MohamedBinZayed "We appreciate that people are debating whether this is a pandemic or not. We are monitoring the situation every moment of every day & analyzing the data.
WHO will not hesitate to describe this [#COVID19] as a pandemic if that‚Äôs what the evidence suggests"-@DrTedros  #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MohamedBinZayed "But containment of #COVID19 is feasible and must remain the top priority for all countries.

With early, aggressive measures, countries can stop transmission and save lives"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MohamedBinZayed "If this [#COVID19] was an influenza epidemic, we would have expected to see widespread community transmission across the globe by now, and efforts to slow it down or contain it would not be feasible"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MohamedBinZayed "We are in unchartered territory. We have never before seen a respiratory pathogen that is capable of community transmission, but which can also be contained with the right measures"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MohamedBinZayed "That‚Äôs important because it indicates that surveillance measures are working & üá∞üá∑‚Äôs epidemic can still be contained.
üá∞üá∑‚Äôs situation also underlines that this is a unique virus with unique features. This virus is not influenza"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MohamedBinZayed "The Republic of #Korea üá∞üá∑ has now reported over 4200 #COVID19 cases & 22 deaths, meaning it has more than half of all cases outside üá®üá≥.

However, the cases in üá∞üá∑ appear to be coming mostly from suspected cases from the 5 known clusters, rather than the community"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MohamedBinZayed "A WHO staff member in our #Iran country office has now tested positive for #COVID19. He has mild disease"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "A WHO team arrived in #Iran this afternoon to deliver supplies and support the government in the #COVID19 response.

I thank Crown Prince Sheikh @MohamedBinZayed of the United Arab Emirates for his support in making this mission possible"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "In the last 24 hours there were almost 9 times more #COVID19 cases reported outside #China than inside üá®üá≥.

The epidemics in the Republic of Korea, Italy, Iran and Japan are our greatest concern"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "The number of #COVID19 cases in üá®üá≥ continues to decline. Yesterday, üá®üá≥ reported 206 cases to WHO, the lowest since 22 January. Only 8 cases were reported outside Hubei province.

Outside üá®üá≥, a total of 8739 cases have been reported from 61 countries, with 127 deaths"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Your risk depends on where you live, your age & general health. WHO can provide general guidance. You should also follow your national guidance and consult your local health professionals"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We don‚Äôt need to wait for vaccines & therapeutics. There are things every individual can do to protect themselves & others today"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "At the same time, work is also progressing on vaccines and therapeutics.

More than 20 vaccines are in development globally, and several therapeutics are in clinical trials. We expect the first results in a few weeks"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "It calls for all countries to educate their populations, to expand surveillance, to find, isolate and care for every #COVID19 case, to trace every contact, and to take an all-of-government and all-of-society approach ‚Äì this is not a job for the health ministry alone"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "The report includes a wealth of information, and 22 recommendations for #China, for affected and unaffected countries, for the international community, and the general public"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "The report of the WHO-#China Joint Mission has now published its report, which is available in ENG on the WHO website & will also be posted in CH on the National Health Commission website"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "As I said yesterday, there are different scenarios in different countries, and different scenarios within the same country. 

The key to containing this #coronavirus is to break the chains of transmission"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "As long as that‚Äôs the case, we still have a chance of containing this #coronavirus, if robust action is taken to detect cases early, isolate and care for patients and trace contacts"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "What we see at the moment are linked epidemics of #COVID19 in several countries, but most cases can still be traced to known contacts or clusters of cases. We do not see evidence as yet that the virus is spreading freely in communities"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros üö® "Our epidemiologists have been monitoring these developments continuously, and we have now increased our assessment of the risk of spread and the risk of impact of #COVID19 to very high at a global level"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "The continued increase in the number of #COVID19 cases, & the number of affected countries over the last few days, are clearly of concern"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Since yesterday, üá©üá∞, üá™üá™, üá±üáπ, üá≥üá± & üá≥üá¨ have all reported their first #COVID19 cases. All these cases have links to #Italy.

24 cases have been exported from üáÆüáπ to 14 countries, and 97 cases have been exported from üáÆüá∑ to 11 countries"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Fear and panic doesn‚Äôt help.

People can have concerns and rightly so.

People can be worried and rightly so.

The most important thing is to calm down and do the right things to fight this very dangerous #coronavirus"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "WHO stands ready to support every country to develop its national plan.

Once again, this is not a time for fear. This is a time for taking action now to prevent #coronavirus infections and save lives now"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "The guidelines also include key performance indicators, and the estimated resources needed to prepare for and respond to a cluster of up to 100 #COVID19 cases. This is not enough, so we will do more"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We‚Äôve issued operational guidelines, with concrete actions countries can take in eight key areas to prevent, detect and manage #COVID19 cases"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We‚Äôve shipped testing kits to 57 countries and personal protective equipment to 85 countries who need it.

We have trained more than 80,000 #healthworkers through our online courses, in multiple languages"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Our message continues to be that this #coronavirus has pandemic potential and WHO is providing the tools to help every country to prepare accordingly"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "If the answer to any of these questions is no, your country has a gap that this #coronavirus will exploit.

Even developed countries could be surprised"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "These are the questions that every health minister must be ready to answer now.

These are the questions that will be the difference between 1 #COVID19 case and 100 cases in the coming days and weeks"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "It‚Äôs not usually a runny üëÉ. In 90% of #COVID19 cases it‚Äôs a ü§í & in 70% of cases a dry cough.

Are we ready to fight rumours & misinformation with clear & simple messages that people can understand?"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Are we ready to treat patients with severe or critical #COVID19? 

Do our hospitals & clinics have the right procedures to prevent & control #coronavirus infections?

Do our people have the right information? Do they know what the disease looks like?"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Do our #healthworkers know how to take samples correctly from patients?

Do we have the right measures at airports & border crossings to test people who are sick?

Do our labs have the right chemicals that allow them to test samples?
..."-@DrTedros #coronavirus #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"How will we know if there are #COVID19 cases in other areas of the country?

Is there a reporting system that health facilities are all using & a way to raise an üö® if there is a concern?

Do our #healthworkers have the training & equipment they need to stay safe?
..."-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "There are some vital questions that every country must be asking itself today. 

Are we ready for the first #COVID19 case? What will we do when it arrives?

Do we have an isolation unit ready to go? Do we have enough medical oxygen, ventilators & other equipment?
..."-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "But we are not hopeless. We are not defenseless. There are things every country and every person can do"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Every country needs to be ready to:
-detect #COVID19 cases early
-isolate patients
-trace contacts
-provide quality clinical care
-prevent hospital outbreaks & community transmission"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "That doesn‚Äôt mean those countries won‚Äôt have more #COVID19 cases.
As of Tuesday, both üá´üáÆ & üá∏üá™ had reported no cases for >2 weeks, but unfortunately both had new cases yesterday"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "There are several countries that have not reported a #COVID19 case for more than 2 weeks: üáßüá™, üá∞üá≠, üáÆüá≥, üá≥üáµ, üáµüá≠, üá∑üá∫, üá±üá∞ and üáªüá≥.
Each of these countries is different & each shows that aggressive, early measures can prevent transmission before #coronavirus gets a foothold"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "But this #coronavirus is not influenza. With the right measures, it can be contained.

That is one of the key messages from #China. The evidence we have is that there does not appear to be widespread community transmission"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "The #COVID19 epidemics in the Islamic Republic of Iran, Italy and the Republic of Korea demonstrate what this #coronavirus is capable of"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "My message to each of these countries is: this is your window of opportunity.

If you act aggressively now, you can contain this #coronavirus.

You can prevent people getting sick.

You can save lives"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:

But as you know, it‚Äôs what is happening in the rest of the üåç that is now our greatest concern. Outside üá®üá≥, there are 3474 cases in 44 countries & 54 deaths"-@DrTedros

text:
Given that #COVID19 is a new disease, it is understandable that its emergence and spread cause confusion, anxiety and fear among the general public. These factors can give rise to harmful stereotypes.

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: Stigma occurs when people negatively associate an infectious disease with a specific population. This means that people are being labelled, stereotyped, separated and/or experience loss of status and discrimination because of a potential negative affiliation with #COVID19. https://t.co/B0OdgjvdVC

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
Since the emergence of #COVID19 we have seen instances of public stigmatization among specific populations and the rise of harmful stereotypes.

text: @DrTedros @EU_Commission "#COVID19 is a shared threat. We can only face it together, and we can only overcome it together"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "I wish to thank the @EU_Commission for its contribution of 232 million euros, which demonstrates the kind of global solidarity that gives me hope"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus 

https://t.co/Bzp8XUbcMJ

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "But there are at least 3 priorities:
3. We must protect countries that are the most vulnerable, by doing our utmost to contain epidemics in countries with the capacity to do it"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "There is no one-size-fits-all approach. Every country must make its own risk assessment for its own context"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Using the word pandemic now does not fit the facts, but it may certainly cause fear.

We do not live in a binary, black-and-white world.

It‚Äôs not either-or.

We must focus on containment, while doing everything we can to prepare for a potential pandemic"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Our decision about whether to use the word ‚Äúpandemic‚Äù to describe an epidemic is based on an ongoing assessment of the geographical spread of the virus, the severity of disease it causes and the impact it has on the whole of society"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "There‚Äôs a lot of speculation about whether these increases mean that this epidemic has now become a pandemic.

WHO has already declared a PHEIC ‚Äì our highest level of alarm ‚Äì when there were less than 100 cases outside üá®üá≥ & 8 cases of human-to-human transmission"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Outside #China, there are now 2074 #COVID19 cases in 28 countries & 23 deaths.

The sudden increases of cases in Italy, the Islamic Republic of Iran & the Republic of Korea are deeply concerning"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Dr Bruce Aylward will give more detail tomorrow on behalf of the joint team. But the key message that should give all countries hope, courage and confidence is that this #coronavirus can be contained"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "The team also estimate that the measures taken in #China have averted a significant number of #COVID19 cases. 

The report contains a wealth of other information, highlights questions for which we still don‚Äôt have answers, & includes 22 recommendations"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "They found that the fatality rate is between 2%-4% in Wuhan, üá®üá≥ & 0.7% outside Wuhan. 

They found that for people with mild #COVID19 disease, recovery time is about two weeks, while people with severe or critical disease recover within three to six weeks"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "They found that the #COVID19 epidemic peaked & plateaued between the 23rd of January & the 2nd of February & has been declining steadily since then.

They have found that there has been no significant change in the DNA of the #coronavirus"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "The team has made a range of findings about the transmissibility of the #coronavirus, the severity of #COVID19 and the impact of the measures taken"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Earlier today the WHO-#China joint mission concluded its visit & delivered its report.

As you know, the team has traveled to several different provinces, including Wuhan"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC @JNkengasong @UN @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan The full briefing on #COVID19 preparedness in Africa by @DrTedros üëá
https://t.co/yU03auKqee

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC @JNkengasong @UN @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan "I assure you that WHO is committed to working with all African countries to do everything we can to prevent transmission, and detect and treat cases as early as possible"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC @JNkengasong @UN @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan "The increasing signs of transmission outside #China show that the window of opportunity we have for containing this #coronavirus is narrowing.

We are calling on all countries to invest urgently in preparedness"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC @JNkengasong @UN @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan "We have also held two calls with @UN resident coordinators all over the world, to brief them on the actions they can take to prepare their countries and ensure the United Nations system is working as one"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC @JNkengasong "2 weeks ago I briefed @UN SG @antonioguterres & we agreed to activate the UN Crisis Management Team, led by @DrMikeRyan, to enable WHO to focus on the health response while other agencies bring their expertise to bear on the other implications of the #COVID19 outbreak"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC @JNkengasong "We‚Äôre also providing advice to countries on how to do screening, testing, contact tracing & treatment.
Last week we brought the intl. research community together to identify research priorities, especially in the areas of diagnostics, therapeutics & vaccines"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC @JNkengasong "During the past month about 11,000 African #healthworkers have been trained using WHO‚Äôs online courses on #COVID19, which are available free of charge in English, French & other languages at https://t.co/RjHSBkVjlH"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC @JNkengasong "We‚Äôre working with manufacturers of personal protective equipment [PPE] to address the severe disruption in the market for masks, gloves, gowns and other PPE, to ensure we can protect #healthworkers"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC @JNkengasong "We‚Äôve also shipped more than 30,000 sets of personal protective equipment to six countries in Africa, and we‚Äôre ready to ship almost 60,000 more sets to 19 countries in the coming weeks"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC @JNkengasong "Some countries in Africa, including üá®üá©, are also leveraging the capacity they have built up to test for #Ebola to test for #COVID19. This is a great example of how investing in health systems can pay dividends for health security"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC @JNkengasong "Increasing number of African countries are now able to test for #COVID19 with laboratory test kits supplied by WHO, compared with only two labs just a couple of weeks ago"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC @JNkengasong "We‚Äôve published a Strategic Preparedness & Response Plan, with a call for US$675m to support countries, especially the most vulnerable.

WHO has identified 13 priority countries in Africa because of their direct links to #China or the high volume of travel with üá®üá≥"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov @AfricaCDC "We have just appointed Dr @JNkengasong, Director @AfricaCDC & Prof Samba Sow, Director-General of the Center for Vaccine Development in üá≤üá±, as special envoys on #COVID19, to provide strategic advice and high-level political advocacy & engagement in Africa"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov "Our biggest concern continues to be the potential for #COVID19 to spread in countries with weaker health systems. 

In partnership with the @AfricaCDC, we‚Äôre working hard to prepare countries in Africa for the potential arrival of the virus"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov "In 2% of reported cases, the #coronavirus is fatal, and the risk of death increases the older a patient is, and with underlying health conditions. 

We see relatively few cases among children. More research is needed to understand why"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov "20% of patients have severe or critical #COVID19, ranging from shortness of breath to septic shock & multi-organ failure. These patients require intensive care using equipment such as respiratory support machines that are in short supply in many African countries"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @_AfricanUnion @NCDCgov "With every day that passes, we know a little bit more about this #coronavirus & the disease it causes.

We know that more than 80% of patients have mild disease & will recover"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion "As you know, a WHO-led international team of experts ‚Äì including a representative from the @NCDCgov ‚Äì has been on the ground in #China for the past week"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @_AfricanUnion "We are especially concerned about the increase in cases in the Islamic Republic of #Iran, where there are now 18 cases & 4 deaths in just the past two days.

WHO has supplied testing kits to üáÆüá∑ & we will continue to provide further support in the coming days & weeks"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion "Although the total number of #COVID19 cases outside #China remains relatively small, we are concerned about the number of cases with no clear epidemiological link, such as travel history to üá®üá≥ or contact with a confirmed case"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @_AfricanUnion "Outside üá®üá≥, there are now 1200 cases in 26 countries, with 8 deaths. As you know, there is one confirmed case on the African continent, in üá™üá¨.
Several African countries have tested suspected cases of #COVID19, but fortunately they have been found negative"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @_AfricanUnion "üá®üá≥ has now reported 75,569 #COVID19 cases to WHO, including 2239 deaths.
The data from üá®üá≥ continue to show a decline in new cases. This is welcome news, but it must be interpreted very cautiously. It‚Äôs far too early to make predictions about this outbreak"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion "As you know, WHO declared a Public Health Emergency of International Concern less than a month after the first reported #COVID19 cases, as a result of the signs of human-to-human transmission we saw outside #China"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion "In just 7 weeks, the #COVID19 outbreak has captured the üåç‚Äôs attention, and rightly so, because it has the potential to cause severe political, social & economic upheaval"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @_AfricanUnion "It‚Äôs hard to believe that only 52 days ago, WHO‚Äôs country office in #China was notified of a cluster of cases of pneumonia of unknown cause in Wuhan city"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

text: @JNkengasong @AfricaCDC @pahowho @WHOWPRO @DrTedros Here are some photos from today's media briefing on #COVID19 https://t.co/EUfdF0wFTD

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@JNkengasong @AfricaCDC @pahowho @WHOWPRO @DrTedros The full briefing on #COVID19 by @DrTedros üëá

https://t.co/VKA8ZkZmLo

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @JNkengasong @AfricaCDC @pahowho @WHOWPRO @DrTedros "We must not look back and regret that we failed to take advantage of the window of opportunity we have"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@JNkengasong @AfricaCDC @pahowho @WHOWPRO @DrTedros "The measures #China & other countries have taken have given us a fighting chance of containing the spread of the #coronavirus. 

We call on all countries to continue their containment measures, while preparing for community transmission if it occurs"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@JNkengasong @AfricaCDC @pahowho @WHOWPRO @DrTedros "As I said yesterday, WHO‚Äôs key role is coordinating the global response to the epidemic & our new special envoys will help us to do that.

This is another step we are taking to take advantage of the window of opportunity we have to contain the #COVID19 outbreak"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"...
Dr @JNkengasong, Director @AfricaCDC

Dr Mirta Roses, former Director @pahowho

Dr Shin Young-soo, former Director @WHOWPRO

Prof Samba O. Sow, Director-General Center for Vaccine Development in üá≤üá±"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @AfricaCDC "I‚Äôm pleased that the following eminent individuals have accepted my invitation to act in this role:
Prof Dr Maha El Rabbat, former Minister of Health of üá™üá¨

Dr @davidnabarro, special adviser to the @UN Secretary-General on the @GlobalGoalsUN & Climate Change

..."-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @AfricaCDC "I‚Äôm also pleased to announce that today we are appointing four special envoys on #COVID19, to provide strategic advice and high-level political advocacy and engagement in different parts of the world"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @AfricaCDC "We are working with all of partners under the GOARN network to safeguard the health of the members of the team, and to take appropriate measures when they return to their countries of origin"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @AfricaCDC "Meanwhile, the WHO-led joint mission in #China has been working in Beijing, Sichuan and Guangdong, and will travel to Wuhan tomorrow to continue its work at the epicenter of the outbreak"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Our concern continues to be the potential for #COVID19 to spread in countries with weaker health systems. 

Tomorrow I will address an emergency meeting of African health ministers, held jointly by the African Union and the @AfricaCDC"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We are also concerned about the increase in #COVID19 cases in the Islamic Republic of #Iran, where there are now 18 cases and four deaths.

WHO has supplied testing kits, and will continue to provide further support"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Apart from the #DiamondPrincess cruise ship, the Republic of #Korea now has the most cases outside #China, and we‚Äôre working closely with the government to fully understand the transmission dynamics that led to this increase"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Although the total number of #COVID19 cases outside üá®üá≥ remains relatively small, we are concerned about the number of cases with no clear epidemiological link, such as travel history to üá®üá≥ or contact with a confirmed case"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Outside #China, there are now 1152 #COVID19 cases in 26 countries & 8 deaths"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Although the number of #COVID19 cases in Hubei province continues declining, we are concerned about an increase in the number of cases in Shandong province, and we are seeking more information about that"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "This may indicate because the health system in Wuhan, üá®üá≥ have regained the ability to test all suspected #COVID19 cases.

As a result, some cases that had been clinically confirmed have now been subtracted from the total because they have tested negative"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "The significant üìâ in confirmed cases is partly due to another change in the way üá®üá≥ reports numbers.
Last week üá®üá≥ started reporting clinically-diagnosed cases, in addition to lab-confirmed cases. They have now switched back to reporting suspected & lab-confirmed cases"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "As of 6am GVA time this morning, #China has reported a total of 75,567 cases of #COVID19 to WHO, including 2,239 deaths.

In the past 24 hours, üá®üá≥ has reported 892 new confirmed cases and 118 deaths"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

text:

text:

However, we have not yet seen the sustained local transmission, except in specific circumstances like the #DiamondPrincess cruise ship"-@DrTedros #coronavirus https://t.co/IZ1xNREeXg

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHOAFRO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO "So far there are 92 #COVID19 cases in 12 countries outside #China of human-to-human transmission.

At the moment we don‚Äôt have enough data on cases outside üá®üá≥ to make a meaningful comparison on the severity of disease or the case fatality rate"-@DrTedros #coronavirus https://t.co/h1sDuzJAGk

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO "We have now had cases of #COVID19 outside #China for more than a month. We are supporting national authorities in every country that has cases to track the virus and understand how people were infected"-@DrTedros #coronavirus https://t.co/0WIxo1urrc

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "In the past 24 hours, there have been 110 new #COVID19 cases outside #China, including 99 on the #DiamondPrincess cruise ship"-@DrTedros #coronavirus https://t.co/tHMxRhgDXd

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Although we are now devoting a lot of attention to #COVID19, WHO is still responding to many other emergencies around the world"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "In the coming days, WHO is sending essential medicine & supplies across the border from üáπüá∑ to #Syria. We are sending supplies for trauma, intensive & surgical care to Idleb & Aleppo governorates; in addition to drugs for non-communicable diseases & #PrimaryHealthCare"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Nearly 900k people have been displaced, including half a million children. Children are particularly prone to hypothermia & respiratory tract infections & due to lack of shelter, many of them are sleeping in the open with their families, exposed to the elements"-@DrTedros #Syria

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "2 attacks on health facilities took place yesterday afternoon, on 2 separate hospitals in Aleppo. Luckily, there were no casualties.

We repeat: health facilities & #healthworkers are #NotATarget in conflict & attacks on health are a breach of international law"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "I‚Äôd like to start today by talking not about #COVID19, but about #Syria.
Since the 1st of December, dozens of health facilities have suspended services in the Idleb & Aleppo areas. Out of nearly 550 health facilities in northwest Syria, only about half are operational"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We‚Äôve put out a call for $675 million to support countries to prepare. I thank those donors who have contributed.

We have a window of opportunity.

We don‚Äôt know how long it will remain open.

Let‚Äôs not squander it"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "WHO is continuing to work night and day on several fronts to prepare countries. We‚Äôre sending testing kits to laboratories around the üåç"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We thank all partners who have made their experts available through the GOARN framework"-@DrTedros #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "The international team of experts now on the ground in #China is working with Chinese counterparts to better understand address those gaps and improve our understanding of the #COVID19 outbreak"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "In 2% of reported #COVID19 cases, the virus is fatal & the risk of death increases the older you are. We see relatively few cases among children. More research is needed to understand why.
These new data address some of the gaps in our understanding, but others remain"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "It‚Äôs too early to tell if this reported decline will continue. Every scenario is still on the table.

It also appears that #COVID19 is not as deadly as other coronaviruses including SARS and MERS"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "The data also appear to show a decline in new #COVID19 cases. This trend must be interpreted very cautiously. Trends can change as new populations are affected"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "They [the data] are very important in enabling WHO to provide good evidence-based advice to countries. We encourage all countries to share their data publicly"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Today #China has published a paper with detailed data on over 44,000 confirmed cases of #COVID19.

These data give us a better understanding about the age range of people affected, the severity of the disease and the mortality rate"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Outside #China, WHO has received reports of 694 #COVID19 cases from 25 countries & three deaths. 

As more data comes in from üá®üá≥, we‚Äôre starting to get a clearer picture of the outbreak, how it‚Äôs developing & where it could be headed"-@DrTedros #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf @Facebook @Google @Pinterest @TencentGlobal @Twitter @tiktok_us @YouTube ‚ÄúIn our fractured and divided üåé, health is one of the few areas in which international cooperation offers the opportunity for countries to work together for a common cause‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf @Facebook @Google @Pinterest @TencentGlobal @Twitter @tiktok_us @YouTube ‚ÄúWe have a choice. Can we come together to face a common and dangerous enemy? Or will we allow fear, suspicion and irrationality to distract and divide us?‚Äù-DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf @Facebook @Google @Pinterest @TencentGlobal @Twitter @tiktok_us @YouTube ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs easy to blame. It‚Äôs easy to politicize. It‚Äôs harder to tackle a problem together, and find solutions together.
We will all learn lessons from this #COVID19 outbreak. But now is not the time for recriminations or politicization‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf @Facebook @Google @Pinterest @TencentGlobal @Twitter @tiktok_us @YouTube ‚ÄúToo much has been written & said about my praise for üá®üá≥.
I have given credit where it‚Äôs due & I will continue to do that, as I would for any country that fights an outbreak aggressively at its source to protect its own people & the üåé, even at great cost to itself‚Äù-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf @Facebook @Google @Pinterest @TencentGlobal @Twitter @tiktok_us @YouTube ‚ÄúNow more than ever is the time for us to let science and evidence lead policy.
If we don‚Äôt, we are headed down a dark path that leads nowhere but division and disharmony‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf @Facebook @Google @Pinterest @TencentGlobal @Twitter @tiktok_us @YouTube ‚ÄúIn many countries, measures have been taken by one part of government without appropriate consultation with the health ministry, or consideration of the impact of those measures‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf @Facebook @Google @Pinterest @TencentGlobal @Twitter @tiktok_us @YouTube ‚ÄúWe call on all governments, companies and news organizations to work with us to sound the appropriate level of alarm, without fanning the flames of hysteria.‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why we‚Äôre also working with search & media companies like @Facebook, @Google, @Pinterest, @TencentGlobal, @Twitter, @tiktok_us, @YouTube and others to counter the spread of rumours & misinformation‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus #KnowtheFacts

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not just fighting an epidemic; we‚Äôre fighting an infodemic.
Fake news spreads faster and more easily than this #coronavirus & is just as dangerous‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWHO is working with manufacturers & distributors of personal protective equipment to ensure a reliable supply of the tools health workers need to do their job safely and effectively‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚Äúüá®üá≥ has bought the world time. We don‚Äôt know how much time.
All countries must be prepared for the arrival of #COVID19 cases, to treat patients with dignity and compassion, and to prevent onward transmission & to protect healthworkers‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúToday, I have 3‚É£ requests for the international community.
1‚É£ we must use the window of opportunity we have to intensify our preparedness‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúThis is frankly difficult to understand, and dangerously short-sighted‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 https://t.co/bbHSD0VGyq

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúThe üåé spends billions of üíµ preparing for a terrorist attack, but relatively little preparing for the attack of a ü¶†, which could be far more deadly & far more damaging economically, politically & socially‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúFor too long, the world has operated on a cycle of panic and neglect. We throw money at an outbreak, and when it‚Äôs over, we forget about it and do nothing to prevent the next one‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúTwo years ago, @WHO & @WorldBank founded the Global Preparedness Monitoring Board, an independent body to assess the state of the üåé‚Äôs readiness for a pandemic.
Last year the board published its 1st report, which concluded the world remains dangerously unprepared.‚Äù-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúThe outbreaks of both #Ebola and #COVID19 underscore once again the vital importance for all countries to invest in preparedness, not panic‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúAnd most of all, we‚Äôre concerned about the potential havoc this #coronavirus could wreak in countries with weaker health systems‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre concerned about the level of rumours and misinformation that are hampering the #COVID19 response‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre concerned about the severe disruption in the market for personal protective equipment, which is putting front line health workers and carers at risk‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre concerned by the lack of urgency in funding the #COVID19 response‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre concerned by reports from China yesterday about the number of health workers who have been infected or have died‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 on #COVID19 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúBut we also have several concerns.
We‚Äôre concerned by the continued increase in the number of #COVID19 cases in #China‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre encouraged that an international team of experts is now on the ground in #China, working closely with their Chinese counterparts to understand the #COVID19 outbreak, and to inform the next steps in the global response‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre encouraged that we have been able to ship #COVID19 diagnostic kits, as well as supplies of masks, gloves, gowns and other personal protective equipment to some of the countries that need it most‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre encouraged that the global research community has come together to identify and accelerate the most urgent research needs for #COVID19 diagnostics, treatments and vaccines‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre encouraged that outside #China, we have not yet seen widespread #COVID19 community transmission‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWe are encouraged that the steps #China has taken to contain the #COVID19 outbreak at its source appear to have bought the world time, even though those steps have come at great cost to üá®üá≥ itself‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúLet me be clear: it is impossible to predict which direction this #COVID19 outbreak will take.
What I can tell you is what encourages us, and what concerns us‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúThe second of these 3‚É£ scenarios is what we are seeing now with the outbreak of #COVID19.
With 99% of cases in #Chinaüá®üá≥, this is still very much an emergency for that country‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020 #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚Äú3‚É£ the deliberate or accidental release of biological agents ‚Äì a hopefully rare event for which we must nonetheless be prepared‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

https://t.co/PoaaTRvrLz

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf "2‚É£ The emergence of a pathogen with pandemic potential, moving rapidly from country to country and requiring an immediate and large-scale response in countries‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

https://t.co/PoaaTRvrLz

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúIn the last few years, 80% of outbreaks requiring an international response have occurred in countries affected by fragility, conflict and insecurity"-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúThere are 3‚É£ main scenarios in which a coordinated response between the health & security sectors is essential:
1‚É£ high-impact epidemics in situations of conflict and insecurity, such as #Ebola"-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúHealth security is therefore not just the health sector‚Äôs business. It‚Äôs everybody‚Äôs business‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWithout peace, health can be an unattainable dream. 
But the opposite can also be true: epidemics have the potential to cause severe political, economic & social instability & insecurity‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúIt was no coincidence:
‚Ä¢the 1918 #flu pandemic erupted in the middle of the WW I
‚Ä¢the final frontier for eradicating #polio is in the most insecure regions of üáµüá∞ & üá¶üá´
‚Ä¢#Ebola has spread in the most insecure region of DRC‚Äù
-@DrTedros #MSC2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúThis experience illustrates a key lesson of history: disease and insecurity are old friends.‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúThis epidemic stands in stark contrast to the previous #Ebola outbreak in the western part of DRC in 2018, an area that is relatively stable and peaceful. That outbreak was controlled in just three months‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSN2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf ‚ÄúWe are finally starting to see the possibility of ending this #Ebola outbreak in #DRC, after more than 18 months & the loss of 2,249 lives. In the past week there has been just 1 case, compared with 120 cases a week at the peak of the outbreak in April‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf "I‚Äôd like to thank the üá®üá© President for his leadership & for his vision of a healthier & safer #DRC"-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @MunSecConf Yesterday I was in Kinshasa, in #DRC, meeting with the President & other senior ministers to review progress against the #Ebola outbreak & to work together on a plan to strengthen üá®üá©‚Äôs health system so that it never sees another outbreak like this again‚Äù-@DrTedros at #MSC2020

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: Live with @DrTedros on health security from the @MunSecConf. #MSC2020 https://t.co/nAlSD06YIR

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Lastly, I want to say again, from my heart, that this is the time for solidarity, not stigma. There are worrying signs that the world is not hearing the call for unity & standing in unison with those at the epicenter in üá®üá≥ who are saving lives & alleviating suffering"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Today hundreds of passengers are disembarking and are en route to their home countries.
20 passengers who reported signs of illness have tested negative for the #COVID19 virus.
I hope that other countries will follow #Cambodia‚Äôs lead"-@DrTedros from #DRC 
https://t.co/Nkvn9vH8ck

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "I wish to thank #Cambodia for demonstrating to the world the meaning of solidarity. While other countries turned away the #Westerdam cruise ship, üá∞üá≠ allowed it to dock"-@DrTedros from #DRC #COVID19 
https://t.co/xdZNulLIyU

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We‚Äôre working with our Chinese counterparts on these issues, and this is also part of the scope of work for the WHO-led joint mission with #China"-@DrTedros from #DRC #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Clearly this is an evolving picture. #HealthWorkers & responders in #China are working with virtually no sleep in difficult conditions. But we need to ensure that we‚Äôre getting the most accurate data, as quickly as possible, to assist üá®üá≥ & support the global response"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "It will be important to review which type of information is needed so that the world can use this window of opportunity to prepare health systems and workers for possible outbreaks"-@DrTedros from #DRC #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "Particular attention will be paid to understanding the transmission of the virus, the severity of disease & the impact of ongoing response measures"-@DrTedros from #DRC

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @Presidence_RDC @UN "The goal of the joint mission is to rapidly inform the next steps in the #COVID19 response & preparedness activities in #China & globally"-@DrTedros from #DRC

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @Presidence_RDC @UN "The Joint Mission will include in-depth workshops, a data review with the principal ministries, meetings with key national-level institutions & field visits in three provinces to understand the application & impact of response activities at provincial & county levels"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @Presidence_RDC @UN "I‚Äôm glad to say that the WHO-led Joint Mission with üá®üá≥ on #COVID19 is moving forward. We expect the full team to touch down over the weekend.

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @Presidence_RDC @UN "We have been in regular contact with suppliers, asking them to prioritize production and distribution of personal protective equipment to #healthworkers on the front lines. We are also in touch with Member States on this important issue"-@DrTedros #COVID19

text: @DrTedros @Presidence_RDC @UN "WHO guidelines have been developed for #healthworkers taking care of hospitalised adults and paediatric patients with acute infections. These guidelines have been made available to all countries"-@DrTedros #COVID19

text: @DrTedros @Presidence_RDC @UN "This is a critical piece of information, because #healthworkers are the glue that holds the health system & outbreak response together. name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @Presidence_RDC @UN "I am glad to say that countries around the world are in a better state of preparedness for #COVID19 than they were just a week ago, and WHO‚Äôs efforts to help countries boost their lab capacity continue"-@DrTedros from #DRC

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @Presidence_RDC @UN "Whether it‚Äôs #Ebola or #COVID19, investing in preparedness is the smartest way to ensure disease outbreaks are identified and stopped quickly"-@DrTedros from #DRC

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @Presidence_RDC @UN "But it is also vitally important that resources and attention focus on strengthening the country‚Äôs health system and bolstering preparedness"-@DrTedros from #DRC

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @Presidence_RDC @UN "I have been impressed with the commitment of @Presidence_RDC & his government to ending the #Ebola outbreak in eastern #DRC and I would like to urge the whole world to recommit to getting to zero Ebola cases"-@DrTedros

text:
@DrTedros "Nonetheless, the signs are extremely positive in the eastern üá®üá© & I hope that by the time the Emergency Committee reconvenes, we will be able to declare an end to the outbreak.
But even as we near the end of the #Ebola outbreak, we must act now to prevent the next one"-@DrTedros

text:

WHO‚Äôs risk assessment is that the risk of spread is high nationally & regionally & low globally"-@DrTedros
