text: @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHOWPRO On #WomenInScience Day, let's remember Fran√ßoise Barr√©-Sinoussi‚Äôs work on #HIV, which was fundamental to the identification of the virus as the cause of AIDS. https://t.co/GdtNr49c8s

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO @covid19 @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan "If we invest now in rational and evidence-based interventions, we have a realistic chance of stopping the #COVID19 outbreak.

If we don‚Äôt, we could have far more cases ‚Äì and far higher costs ‚Äì on our hands"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO @covid19 @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan "We thank those countries that have contributed so far & we call on all those who haven‚Äôt to contribute urgently"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO @covid19 @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan "It‚Äôs also important to remember that while we need investment in R&D, we also need investment in stopping the #COVID19 outbreak NOW.
Last week, WHO issued a call for $675 million, which is what the world needs to support preparedness & response operations in countries"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO @covid19 @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan "Keep your distance from someone who is coughing or sneezing. 

And when you cough or sneeze, cover your mouth and nose with a tissue or your elbow"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @m_scribe @devisridhar Coronavirus disease 2019 - #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO @covid19 @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan "There are many basic public health interventions that are available to us now, and which can prevent infections now.

We‚Äôve sent supplies to countries to diagnose and treat patients and protect #healthworkers"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO @covid19 @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan "The development of vaccines & therapeutics is one important part of the research agenda ‚Äì but it is only one part. They will take time to develop, but in the meantime, we are not defenceless"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO @covid19 @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan "A research roadmap is also important for organizations that fund research to have a clear sense of what the public health priorities are, so they can make investments that deliver the biggest public health impact"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO @covid19 @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan "The main outcome is an agreed roadmap on what questions we need to ask, and how we will go about answering those questions. 

This is exactly what WHO is for ‚Äì bringing the world together to coordinate the response"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO @covid19 @antonioguterres @DrMikeRyan "As you know, today and tomorrow WHO is hosting a meeting of more than 400 scientists from around the world, both in person and virtually. 

The main outcome we expect from this meeting is not immediate answers to every question"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO @covid19 @antonioguterres "We have also activated a UN Crisis Management Team, to be led by @DrMikeRyan. This will help WHO focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic & developmental implications of the #COVID19 outbreak"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO @covid19 "I also briefed the Secretary-General @antonioguterres and we agreed to leverage the power of the entire @UN system in the #COVID19 response"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO "Last week I told you that we had engaged WHO‚Äôs network of country representatives, as well as the @UN resident coordinators, to brief them on the outbreak and inform them about the steps they can take"-@DrTedros @COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO "As of 6am Geneva time this morning, there were 42,708 confirmed #COVID19 cases reported in #China & tragically we have now surpassed 1000 deaths - 1017 people in üá®üá≥ have lost their lives to this virus.

Outside üá®üá≥, there are 393 cases in 24 countries, with 1 death"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN @OIEAnimalHealth @FAO "Having a name matters to prevent the use of other names that can be inaccurate or stigmatizing. It also gives us a standard format to use for any future coronavirus outbreaks"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho @WHOAFRO @UN_News_Centre @UN "Under agreed guidelines between WHO, the @OIEAnimalHealth & @FAO, we had to find a name that did not refer to a geographical location, an animal, an individual or group of people, and which is also pronounceable and related to the disease"-@DrTedros #COVID19

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros üö® BREAKING üö®

"We now have a name for the #2019nCoV disease: 

COVID-19. 

I‚Äôll spell it: C-O-V-I-D hyphen one nine ‚Äì COVID-19"

-@DrTedros #COVID19 https://t.co/Kh0wx2qfzk

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "On Thursday I will travel to Kinshasa, #DRC for meetings with the President and other senior ministers to look beyond #Ebola, and sketch out ways to strengthen DRC‚Äôs health system"-@DrTedros #HealthForAll

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Regardless of their recommendation, the world needs to continue to fund the #Ebola response. Taking our foot off the accelerator now could be a fatal mistake ‚Äì quite literally"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Tomorrow, the Emergency Committee will meet to assess whether the #Ebola outbreak in #DRC continues to constitute a public health emergency of international concern"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We are still in full response mode. Just yesterday, 5400 alerts were investigated, almost 300 samples were analyzed, more than 700 people were vaccinated almost and 2000 contacts were followed. We are still in full response mode"-@DrTedros #Ebola #DRC

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "But until we have no #Ebola cases for 42 days, it's not over. Any single case could re-ignite the epidemic, and the security situation in eastern #DRC remains extremely fragile"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Although the world is now focused on #2019nCoV, we cannot and must not forget #Ebola in #DRC.

We are very encouraged by the current trend. There have only been 3 cases in the past week, and no cases in the past 3 days"-@DrTedros

üëâhttps://t.co/qKzBSfjmp2 https://t.co/LZZUkuEIRZ

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "WHO remains committed to equitable access to health products for populations that need them, and will work to ensure that access is always part of all R&D efforts"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "That is especially true in relation to sharing of samples and sequences. 

To defeat the #2019nCoV outbreak, we need open and equitable sharing, according to the principles of fairness and equity"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We hope that one of the outcomes of this meeting will be an agreed roadmap for research around which researchers and donors will align. 

The bottom line is solidarity, solidarity, solidarity"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "The R&D Blueprint identifies several known pathogens as priorities for research, but also includes scenarios for ‚Äúpathogen x‚Äù ‚Äì a previously unknown pathogen exactly like the one we are dealing with now"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We activated the R&D Blueprint team in early January to coordinate and facilitate information-sharing on research elements of the #2019nCoV response"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Following the West African #Ebola outbreak, we developed the WHO R&D Blueprint ‚Äì a strategy for developing drugs and vaccines before epidemics, and accelerating research and development activities during epidemics"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "There are also tools we don‚Äôt have. We have no vaccine to prevent infections, and no proven therapeutics to treat them"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"...

‚ùìWhat‚Äôs the best way to manage cases of severe disease? 

‚ùìWhat ethical issues we need to be aware of in the way we do our research?

To defeat this outbreak, we need answers to all those questions, and more"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "There is still so much we don‚Äôt know. 

‚ùìWhat are the reservoirs? 

‚ùìWhat are the transmission dynamics?

‚ùìWhat is the period of infectiousness? 

‚ùìWhich samples should be used for diagnosis & monitoring of treatment?"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We need your collective knowledge, insight and experience to answer the questions we don‚Äôt have answers to, and to identify the questions we may not even realize we need to ask"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"And it‚Äôs a test of scientific solidarity ‚Äì will the world come together to find shared answers to shared problems? 

That‚Äôs why you‚Äôre here. 

This is not a meeting about politics or money. This is a meeting about science"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "It‚Äôs a test of financial solidarity ‚Äì whether the üåç will invest now in fighting the #2019nCoV outbreak, or pay more later to deal with its consequences"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "This #2019nCoV outbreak is testing us in many ways. 

It‚Äôs a test of political solidarity ‚Äì whether the world can come together to fight a common enemy that does not respect borders or ideologies"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "With 99% of #2019nCoV cases in #China, this remains very much an emergency for that country, but one that holds a very grave threat for the rest of the world"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "It‚Äôs hard to believe that just two months ago, the #2019nCoV ‚Äì which has come to captivate the attention of media, financial markets, and political leaders ‚Äì was completely unknown to us"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We want you to know that we stand with you in solidarity & we wish you courage, patience, success and good health in these extremely trying circumstances"-@DrTedros at the opening of the global research and innovation forum on #2019nCoV 

https://t.co/b8PKwexNee

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "I would like to wish you all a very warm welcome to Geneva & to WHO for this very important meeting. I welcome everyone who is joining us virtually, especially our sisters & brothers in #China"-@DrTedros at the opening of the global research and innovation forum on #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
On 11-12 February, WHO is convening a global research and innovation forum to mobilize international action, and identify knowledge gaps & research priorities to contribute to the control of #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @AfricaCDC "WHO will continue working with all countries to prevent and detect rapidly new cases of #2019nCoV, and to save lives"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Another shipment of 150,000 #2019nCOV tests is being assembled in Berlin today & is destined for over 80 labs in all regions.
Last week the @AfricaCDC conducted training in üá∏üá≥ with 12 countries, using tests sent by WHO. Further training will take place in üáøüá¶ next week"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "WHO is working to equip laboratories with the capacity to rapidly diagnose #2019nCoV cases. Without vital diagnostic capacity, countries are in the dark as to how far & wide the virus has spread & who has new coronavirus or another disease with similar symptoms"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "The detection of this small number of #2019nCoV cases could be the spark that becomes a bigger fire.
But for now, it‚Äôs only a spark.
Our objective remains containment.
We call on all countries to use the window of opportunity we have to prevent a bigger fire"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "In recent days we have seen some concerning instances of onward #2019nCoV transmission from people with no travel history to #China, like the cases reported in üá´üá∑ yesterday and the üá¨üáß today"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "2‚É£ An advance team of WHO experts has just arrived in üá®üá≥, led by Dr Bruce Aylward, to lay the groundwork for the larger intl. team.

Bruce & colleagues will be working with their üá®üá≥ counterparts to make sure we have the right expertise to answer the right questions"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "1‚É£ the meeting on research and innovation starting tomorrow will identify some of those questions and chart a path forward"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV 

https://t.co/4hqrnjjkNn

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "A lot of people are asking, where is the #2019nCoV outbreak going? Is it getting better, is it getting worse?

We are doing several things to answer those questions"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "The overall pattern has not changed. 99% of reported #2019nCoV cases are in #China, and most cases are mild. About 2% of cases are fatal ‚Äì which of course is still too many"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "As of 6am Geneva time today, there were 40,235 confirmed #2019nCoV cases in #China, and 909 deaths.

Outside China, there are 319 cases in 24 countries, with 1 death"-@DrTedros

https://t.co/wZ0bHSC8Gp

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @gatesfoundation @wellcometrust @DrTedros "But the response requires more funding and we call upon all donors to please step up"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "It is really important to make sure that all activities of the response are adequately funded at WHO & key partners. Just to mention the donors so far & to thank them: üá∫üá∏, üá¨üáß, üá≥üá±,üá®üáø , üáØüáµ, @gatesfoundation & the @wellcometrust"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @Facebook @Google @TencentGlobal @Twitter @tiktok_uk @Pinterest @instagram @YouTube "I want to thank those donors who have made contributions in the past few days since we launched the $675 million appeal to fuel the #2019nCoV response"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @Facebook @Google @TencentGlobal @Twitter @tiktok_uk @Pinterest @instagram @YouTube "In essence, to fight the flood of misinformation, we are building a band of truth-tellers that disperse fact and debunk myths"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @Facebook @Google @TencentGlobal @Twitter @tiktok_uk @Pinterest "We are connecting with influencers, through @instagram & @YouTube, among others, to help spread factual messages to their followers, with a focus on the Asia-Pacific region"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @Facebook @Google @TencentGlobal @Twitter @tiktok_uk @Pinterest "We are asking them to filter out false information and promote accurate information from credible sources like WHO, CDC and others. And we thank them for their efforts so far"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We are also engaging with search, social and digital companies such as @Facebook, @Google, @TencentGlobal, Baidu, @Twitter, @tiktok_uk, Weibo, @Pinterest & others"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "This includes addressing rumors by publishing ‚Äúmyth busters‚Äù and Live Q&A interviews with experts on our website and social channels and through the media"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "WHO‚Äôs ‚Äòinfodemics‚Äô team is working hand in glove with our communications department to deliver information to a broader public audience"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We‚Äôre leveraging our existing network called EPI-WIN ‚Äì which stands for WHO Information Network for Epidemics. The WHO‚Äôs risk communications and ‚Äòinfodemic‚Äô management team actively track misinformation, in multiple languages"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "At WHO, we‚Äôre not just battling the #2019nCoV virus; we‚Äôre also battling the trolls and conspiracy theorists that push misinformation and undermine the outbreak response. 

However, WHO and partners are fighting back with a four-pronged approach"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "While the #2019nCoV virus spreads, misinformation makes the job of our heroic #healthworkers even harder. It is diverting the attention of decision makers. And it causes confusion and spreads fear to the general public"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "I would also like to speak briefly about the importance of facts not fear in the #2019nCoV outbreak. People must have access to accurate information to protect themselves and others"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "On the #2019nCoV, here are the latest figures: As of earlier today, there were 34,598 confirmed cases in #China, and 723 deaths.

Outside China, there were 288 cases in 24 countries, with 1 death"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We must use the momentum in #DRC to finish off this #Ebola outbreak and then look to the future by investing in building a strong and resilient health system that can quickly snuff out outbreaks in the future"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "With improved therapeutics, which are substantially decreasing mortality, as well as a safe & effective vaccine that has now been licensed, the #Ebola response has dramatically strengthened over time & provides a preparedness blueprint to fight future outbreaks"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "However, the progress deserves recognition. Despite ongoing security challenges, responders ‚Äì the majority of whom are local people ‚Äì have adapted and localized the response to increase its effectiveness and acceptance"-@DrTedros #Ebola #DRC

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Since the start of February, there have been three cases of #Ebola in #DRC. It is clearly too soon to celebrate; while there are cases anywhere in üá®üá©, the risk of spread within the country and to neighboring countries remains very high"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "I am going to break with tradition & start with a brief update on the #Ebola outbreak in üá®üá©.
Along with #2019nCoV, it is one of the many disease outbreaks that WHO is combatting around the üåç. At this moment, our Emergencies division is dealing with 216 ongoing events"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: Daily media briefing on #2019nCoV with @DrTedros https://t.co/r3LhPdWtNL https://t.co/7YQA3s9j5n

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "I would like to take a moment to convey my deep appreciation to the Chair, Dr. Nakatani, for his invaluable support and the leadership he has provided in advancing the work of the Board"-@DrTedros #EB146 https://t.co/DXbeXbJ5SB

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "It is also the kickoff to the Decade of Aging where we will bring key stakeholders together to improve the lives of older people, their families and the communities in which they live"-@DrTedros #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "This is the Year of the Nurse and the Midwife, the theme of our #WHA73 and a major theme of our activities this year"-@DrTedros #SupportNursesAndMidwives #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "I want to commend the government of #DRC for their leadership, the #healthworkers on the frontlines who are helping keep the world safe, as well as the investment into science that led to vaccines and therapeutics, and to all partners"-@DrTedros #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We have kept you & the üåç, updated on the #2019nCoV outbreak throughout the #EB146 & will continue to provide regular updates & technical guidance.
Solidarity, collaboration, transparency & prompt sharing of data & accurate advice are key to defeating the virus"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Preparedness is very much at the top of all our minds this week, as WHO staff and partners work with countries to respond to the #2019nCoV outbreak. Our late friend and colleague Pete Salama would have been proud"-@DrTedros #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Thank you in particular for bringing your work on Preparedness to a positive conclusion, which sends an important message to the world at this critical moment"-@DrTedros #Eb146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "I want to congratulate & thank you for the great progress made this week moving forward debates, decisions & resolutions. 
There was major progress on key issues incl. Neglected Tropical Diseases, the Global Vaccine Action Plan, cervical cancer, and food safety"-@DrTedros #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We call countries and companies to work with WHO to ensure fair and rational use of supplies, and the rebalancing of the market.

We all have a part to play in keeping each other safe"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We are appreciative of companies that have taken the decision to only supply masks to medical professionals.

There is limited stock of PPE, and we need to make sure we get it to the people who need it most, in the places that need it most"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "I spoke to the Pandemic Supply Chain Network, which incl. manufacturers, distributors & logistics providers, to ensure that PPE supplies get to those who need them. The network is focusing initially on surgical masks because of the extreme demand & market pressures"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "WHO estimates that global frontline health emergency responders will require approximately 7% to 10% of market capacity. This percentage may be higher for other critical supplies.
Frontline #healthworkers in #China require the bulk of PPE supplies"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "This situation has been exacerbated by widespread, inappropriate use of PPE outside patient care. As a result, there are now depleted stockpiles & backlogs of 4-6 months. Global stocks of masks & respirators are now insufficient to meet the needs of WHO & our partners"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "WHO is sending testing kits, masks, gloves, respirators & gowns to countries in every region. However, the üåç is facing severe disruption in the market for personal protective equipment. Demand is up to 100x higher than normal & prices are up to 20x higher"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

text: Daily media briefing on #2019nCoV with @DrTedros https://t.co/r3LhPdWtNL

transport systems for all.

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @UN The full briefing by @DrTedros üëâ https://t.co/gpfXDFZnSb

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We are also mobilizing the full power of the @UN system to respond to the #2019nCoV emergency.

We‚Äôre bringing together partners to identify capacity and gaps, and who is best positioned to fill those gaps"-@DrTedros #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "This afternoon I will be speaking to the Pandemic Supply Chain Network to identify the bottlenecks and find solutions, and push with fairness in distribution of equipment"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We are sending testing kits, masks, gloves, respirators and gowns to countries in every region.

However, the world is facing a chronic shortage of personal protective equipment, as you might imagine"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: "So far we have received pledges for $110 million. Several donors have already come forward, and we are expecting more announcements in the coming days"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @pahowho @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "We also briefed you on the Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan, which estimates that the world needs $675 million for the next three months to invest in preventing this #2019nCoV outbreak"-@DrTedros #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @pahowho @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "This act of solidarity is helping us to understand the #2019nCoV outbreak better, which will help us to stop it sooner"-@DrTedros #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @pahowho @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "On Tuesday I said that several countries were lagging behind on sharing #2019nCoV data with WHO. I‚Äôm pleased to report that since then, several countries have shared this vital information and others have indicated they will share it very soon ‚Äì thank you"-@DrTedros #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @UN @antonioguterres "Keeping the world safe is in our DNA. If countries invest now in prevention and research, we can avoid more #2019nCoV cases and more costs down the line"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @UN @antonioguterres "It speeds up the availability of the medicines and technologies that save lives. 

We‚Äôve seen that with the rapid development of an #Ebola vaccine"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @UN @antonioguterres "But this is something WHO has been working on for years. 
Following the West African #Ebola outbreak, we developed the WHO R&D Blueprint ‚Äì a global strategy for developing drugs and vaccines before epidemics, and accelerating R&D activities during epidemics"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @UN @antonioguterres "The aim is to fast-track the development of effective diagnostic tests, vaccines and medicines.

One of the key challenges is coordinating research funders to support key priorities"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @UN @antonioguterres "That‚Äôs why on February 11-12 we are convening a global research & innovation forum to identify research priorities & coordinate the international research effort.
This will be a meeting of scientists from all over the world, including üá®üá≥, both in person & virtually"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @UN @antonioguterres "And there are tools we don‚Äôt have. We have no vaccine to prevent infections, and no therapeutics to treat them. 

To put it bluntly: we‚Äôre shadow-boxing. We need to bring the #2019nCoV out into the light so we can attack it properly"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @UN @antonioguterres "Having the genetic sequence of the #2019nCoV has enabled the rapid development of tests, and as I mentioned yesterday, we have shipped 250,000 tests to more than 70 laboratories around the world, and we‚Äôre training lab workers to use them"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @UN @antonioguterres "It‚Äôs hard to believe that just 2 months ago, the #2019nCoV virus was unknown to us. We have already learned so much about it. We know its DNA; it can be transmitted from person to person; those most at risk are older people & those with underlying health conditions"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We are also mobilizing the full power of the @UN system. Yesterday I briefed the Secretary General @antonioguterres  & other UN leaders & today we had a call with over 200 UN country representatives. This follows yesterday‚Äôs call with WHO country representatives"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We expect more announcements in the coming days.
We welcome support from all donors big & small ‚Äì every dollar counts"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "The @gatesfoundation has already made a generous contribution, #Japan has also made a contribution of $10 million & there are a lot of other signals of support"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

https://t.co/NiDcN16vtG

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "I salute all Commissioners for their dedication & outstanding work. My deepest appreciation to the Co-Chairs: The Presidents of üá´üáÆ, üá±üá∞ & üá∫üáæ, the Minister of Health of üá∑üá∫, & especially to @SaniaNishtar for leading & guiding this process.

It‚Äôs time to walk the talk!"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "NCDs are the world‚Äôs biggest killers. 

They claim the lives of 40 million people every year, including 15 million between the ages of 30 and 70. They also result in untold suffering, and a huge economic burden from lower productivity and disabilities"-@DrTedros #BeatNCDs

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "The world is facing a public health emergency: the outbreak of #2019nCoV. An enormous response from WHO, partners, is now underway.

But at the same time, the world is facing another, but quieter epidemic of noncommunicable diseases"-@DrTedros #BeatNCDs

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: Live from Geneva with @DrTedros on the Commission‚Äôs final report on how to #BeatNCDs https://t.co/DErvlwETDZ

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @HelenBranswell @HelenBranswell Thanks for letting us know. Our AV team is working on it

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We understand that people are worried and concerned ‚Äì and rightly so.

But this is not a time for fear ‚Äì it‚Äôs a time for rational, evidence-based action and investment, while we still have a window of opportunity to bring this outbreak under control"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "$675 million is a lot of money, but it is much less than the bill we will face if we do not invest in preparedness now.

Once again, we cannot defeat this outbreak without solidarity ‚Äì political solidarity, technical solidarity and financial solidarity"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Our message to the international community is: 

invest today, or pay more later"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We are requesting $675 million to fund the plan for the next three months. $60 million of that is to fund WHO‚Äôs operations ‚Äì the rest is for the countries that are especially at risk"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "But we need to do more. 

That‚Äôs why today we are launching a Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan, to support countries to prevent, detect and diagnose onward transmission"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We‚Äôre sending 250,000 tests to more than 70 reference laboratories globally to facilitate faster testing"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "WHO has released a total of $9 million from our own Contingency Fund for Emergencies"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We‚Äôre also continuing to provide scientific leadership. Today the Strategic and Technical Advisory Group for Infectious Hazards is meeting to examine what we know and provide advice"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We continue to support the Chinese government‚Äôs efforts to address the #2019nCoV outbreak at the epicenter, at the source, in Wuhan üá®üá≥. We must not forget how difficult this is for the people of Wuhan"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Our greatest concern is about the potential for spread in countries with weaker health systems, and who lack the capacity to detect or diagnose the #2019nCoV virus. We are only as strong as the weakest link"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Last night I said that some high-income countries are well behind in sharing vital case data with WHO. I‚Äôm pleased to report that since then üá¶üá∫ has reported its cases & üáØüáµhas said it will expedite its reporting, although some other countries are still lagging behind"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "So far, 99% of the #2019nCoV cases are in #China, and 80% of cases in üá®üá≥ are from Hubei province.

The relatively small number of cases outside üá®üá≥ gives us a window of opportunity to prevent this outbreak from becoming a broader global crisis"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Outside #China there are 191 #2019nCoV cases in 24 countries & one death, in the #Philippines.

Of those, 31 cases are in people with no travel history to üá®üá≥, but all are close contacts of a confirmed case or of someone from Wuhan"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "As of 6am Geneva time this morning, there are 24,363 confirmed #2019nCoV cases in #China, and 490 deaths.

In the last 24 hours we had the most cases in a single day since the outbreak started"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "[We call on Member States to] facilitate rapid collaboration between the public and private sectors to develop the diagnostics, medicines and vaccines we need to bring this outbreak under control"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "Where such measures have been implemented, we urge that they are short in duration, proportionate to the public health risks, and are reconsidered regularly as the situation evolves"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "We reiterate our call to all countries not to impose restrictions that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade. 

Such restrictions can have the effect of increasing fear and stigma, with little public health benefit"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "We can only defeat this #2019nCoV outbreak with global solidarity, and that starts with collective participation in global surveillance"-@DrTedros #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "Without better data, it‚Äôs very hard for us to assess how the outbreak is evolving, or what impact it could have, and to ensure we are providing the most appropriate recommendations"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "I call on all Member States to share detailed information with WHO ‚Äì including epidemiological, clinical severity and the results of community studies and investigations. This is the responsibility of all countries under the International Health Regulations"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "We are also increasing our communications capacity to counter the spread of rumours and misinformation, and ensure all people receive accurate, reliable information they need to protect themselves and their families"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "We‚Äôre convening a global research meeting next week to identify research priorities in all areas of the outbreak, from identifying the source of the virus to developing vaccines and therapeutics"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "We‚Äôre sending a team of international experts to work with their Chinese counterparts to increase understanding of the outbreak to guide the global response"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "We‚Äôre sending 250,000 tests to more than 70 reference laboratories globally to facilitate faster testing"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "WHO is sending 531,000 masks, 350,000 pairs of gloves, 40,000 respirators & almost 18,000 isolation gowns from our warehouses in Dubai & Accra to 24 countries & we will add more countries"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "Of course, the risk of it becoming more widespread globally remains high. Now is the moment for all countries to be preparing themselves"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "We continue to work closely with the Chinese government to support its efforts to address this outbreak at the epicenter. That is our best chance of preventing a broader global crisis"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "It‚Äôs important to underline that 99% of the cases are in #China, and 97% of deaths are in Hubei province. This is still first and foremost an emergency for China"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV #EB146

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOAFRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @pahowho "The latest data we have is that there are 20,471 confirmed cases in #China, including 425 deaths.

Outside #China there are 176 cases in 24 countries, and one death, in the Philippines"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOSEARO @WHOAFRO @FAO @UN @GlobalGoalsUN @ITU @EIB "Both #Ebola & #2019nCoV illustrate that the current binary PHEIC-or-no-PHEIC system is too blunt an instrument for dealing with complex emergencies. text:

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
The main driver of #2019-nCoV transmission, based on currently available data, is symptomatic cases.
WHO is aware of possible transmission from infected people before they developed symptoms.

WHO Situation Report 1 February 2020 https://t.co/5gEHSOGO7H https://t.co/KlhNDYNbr9

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: Asymptomatic #2019nCoV infection may be rare, and transmission from an asymptomatic person is very rare with other coronaviruses, as we have seen with MERS. Thus, transmission from asymptomatic cases is likely not a major driver of transmission https://t.co/5gEHSOGO7H https://t.co/Zh8ifwP4XA

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @pahowho @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO Q: Is it safe to receive a letter or a package from China?
A: Yes, it is safe. People receiving packages from China are not at risk of contracting #2019nCoV.
From previous analysis, we know coronaviruses do not survive long on objects, such as letters or packages.

#KnowTheFacts https://t.co/RBBqjkd5JQ

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @WHO_Europe @pahowho @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO Q: Do vaccines against pneumonia protect you against #2019nCoV?
A: No. Vaccines against pneumonia do not provide protection against 2019-nCoV.
The virus is new and different. It needs its own vaccine.

#KnowTheFacts https://t.co/xoUz6PzHIo

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO What does Public Health Emergency of Intl Concern means?
WHO issues temporary recommendations. These are non-binding but practically & politically significant measures that can address travel, trade, quarantine, screening, treatment. WHO can also set global standards of practice

text:

text:

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "In total, there are now 7834 confirmed #2019nCoV cases, including 7736 in #China, representing almost 99% of all reported cases worldwide. 170 people have lost their lives to this outbreak, all of them in China"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "We are working diligently with national and international public health partners to bring this outbreak under control as fast as possible"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "To the people of #China & to all of those around the üåèwho have been affected by this outbreak, we want you to know that the üåè stands with you"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "As you know, I was in #China just a few days ago, where I met with President Xi Jinping. I left in absolutely no doubt about China‚Äôs commitment to transparency, and to protecting the world‚Äôs people"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "Let me be clear: this declaration is not a vote of no confidence in #China. On the contrary, WHO continues to have confidence in China‚Äôs capacity to control the outbreak"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "Our greatest concern is the potential for the virus to spread to countries with weaker health systems, and which are ill-prepared to deal with it"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "The main reason for this declaration is not because of what is happening in #China, but because of what is happening in other countries"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO üö®BREAKINGüö®

"For all of these reasons, I am declaring a public health emergency of international concern over the global outbreak of #2019nCoV."-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "We don‚Äôt know what sort of damage this #2019nCoV virus could do if it were to spread in a country with a weaker health system. 
We must act now to help countries prepare for that possibility"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "The vast majority of cases outside #China have a travel history to Wuhan, or contact with someone with a travel history to Wuhan"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "So far we have not seen any deaths outside #China, for which we must all be grateful. Although these numbers are still relatively small compared to the number of cases in üá®üá≥, we must all act together now to limit further spread"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "There are now 98 #2019nCoV cases in 18 countries outside #China, including 8 cases of human-to-human transmission in four countries: Germany, Japan, Viet Nam and the United States of America"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "I also offer my profound respect and thanks to the thousands of brave health professionals and all frontline responders, who in the midst of the Spring Festival, are working 24/7 to treat the sick, save lives and bring this outbreak under control"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "The speed with which #China detected the outbreak, isolated the virus, sequenced the genome and shared it with WHO and the world are very impressive. So is üá®üá≥‚Äôs commitment to transparency and to supporting other countries"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO @pahowho @WHO_Europe @WHOEMRO @WHOAFRO "We would have seen many more cases outside #China by now ‚Äì and probably deaths ‚Äì if it were not for the government‚Äôs efforts, and the progress they have made to protect their own people and the people of the world"-@DrTedros #2019nCoV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)

text: @DrTedros @SCBriand We have to be very careful this early in an outbreak to make conclusion on severity. We have to stick with the facts. What we know now 17 people have died [out of 575 people who have been sick] and their families grieve for them - @DrMikeRyan

#coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros Reduce your risk of #coronavirus infection
https://t.co/PKzKaO2yfK https://t.co/bLmr4z3y1t

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"We are completely committed to ending this [new #coronavirus] outbreak as soon as possible.

And I will not hesitate to reconvene the committee at a moment‚Äôs notice"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "WHO is following this [new #coronavirus] outbreak every minute of every day, at country, regional & global level.

We are working to prevent human-to-human transmission"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "I wish to reiterate that the fact I am not declaring a PHEIC today should not be taken as a sign that WHO does not think the situation is serious, or that we are not taking it seriously.

Nothing could be further from the truth"-@DrTedros on new #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "This [new #coronavirus] outbreak was detected because #China had put in place a system specifically to pick up severe lower respiratory infections. It was that system that caught this event"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "Once again, I‚Äôd like to thank the Government of #China for its cooperation & transparency. The government has been successful in isolating & sequencing the virus very quickly & has shared that genetic sequence with WHO & the international community"-@DrTedros on new #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "There are a few simple things we can all do to protect ourselves and each other, like washing hands, covering your mouth & nose when you sneeze, & so on. 

WHO has a full package of information on its website"-@DrTedros on new #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "All countries should have in place measures to detect cases of #coronavirus, including at health facilities.
The committee has made several recommendations to prevent the further spread of the virus, which the Chair has described, and which I have accepted"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "For the moment, WHO does not recommend any broader restrictions on travel or trade. 
We recommend exit screening at airports as part of a comprehensive set of containment measures"-@DrTedros on new #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "It is likely that we will see more cases in other parts of #China & other countries. üá®üá≥ has taken measures it believes appropriate to contain the spread of coronavirus in Wuhan & other cities. We hope that they will be both effective and short in their duration"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "WHO is working with our partners night and day in #China and the other affected countries, at the regional level and here at headquarters to fill the gaps in our knowledge as quickly as possible"-@DrTedros on new #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "There is still a lot we don‚Äôt know. We don‚Äôt know the source of this virus, we don‚Äôt understand how easily it spreads & we don‚Äôt fully understand its clinical features or severity"-@DrTedros on new #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We know that there is human-to-human transmission in üá®üá≥, but for now it appears limited to family groups & #healthworkers caring for infected patients. At this time, there is no evidence of human-to-human transmission outside üá®üá≥, but that doesn‚Äôt mean it won‚Äôt happen"-@DrTedros

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We know that most of those who have died had underlying health conditions such as hypertension, diabetes or cardiovascular disease that weakened their immune systems"-@DrTedros on new #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "We know that this virus can cause severe disease, and that it can kill, although for most people it causes milder symptoms. 

We know that among those infected, one quarter of patients have experienced severe disease"-@DrTedros on new #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "We are aware of media reports of suspected cases in other countries, but those cases are still being investigated"-@DrTedros on new #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "584 cases have now been reported to WHO, including 17 deaths. 575 of those cases & all of the deaths have been reported in #China, with other cases reported in Japan, the Republic of Korea, Singapore, Thailand, the United States of America & Vietnam"-@DrTedros on #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros "Make no mistake. This is an emergency in #China, but it has not yet become a global health emergency. 

WHO‚Äôs risk assessment is that the outbreak is a very high risk in China, and a high risk regionally and globally"-@DrTedros on new #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
BREAKING: "I am not declaring a public health emergency of international concern [PHEIC] today. 

As it was yesterday, the Emergency Committee was divided over whether the outbreak of novel coronavirus represents a PHEIC"-@DrTedros on new #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "The decision about whether or not to declare a public health emergency of international concern is one I take extremely seriously, and one I am only prepared to make with appropriate consideration of all the evidence"-@DrTedros on new #coronavirus

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros "There was an excellent discussion during the committee today, but it was also clear that to proceed, we need more information. I have decided to ask the Emergency Committee to meet again tomorrow to continue the discussion & the Chair has agreed with that request"-@DrTedros

text:

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:

üî∏reduce the potential health risks to e-cigarette users & non-users
üî∏prohibit false or unproven claims from being made about e-cigarettes
üî∏protect existing tobacco-control efforts https://t.co/sPNa7wOGvY

name: World Health Organization (WHO)

text:
@WHO_Europe @pahowho @WHOAFRO @WHOEMRO @WHOWPRO @WHOSEARO Q: Are secondhand e-cigarettes emissions dangerous?
A: Yes. The aerosols in e-cigarettes typically contain toxic substances, including glycol which is used to make antifreeze.
E-cigarettes pose risks to users and non-users.

text:

There is a risk of the devices leaking, or of children swallowing the liquid. The liquid is also highly flammable. https://t.co/Ufz4gnjiyV

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @InitiativeLome @WHOAFRO @_AfricanUnion "The prize we are working for is not just fewer bad medicines on pharmacy shelves.

The prize we are working for is a healthier Africa.

A safer Africa.

A more prosperous Africa"-@DrTedros

#FakeDrugsRealCrime https://t.co/2konlF4hfr

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @InitiativeLome @WHOAFRO @_AfricanUnion "In an increasingly globalized üåç, no one country has sufficient resources & capacity to effectively regulate the whole supply chain for health products.

Substandard & falsified üíä are a shared problem. We must work together on shared solutions"-@DrTedros #FakeDrugsRealCrime https://t.co/cRP4WxeawY

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @InitiativeLome @WHOAFRO "One of the biggest obstacles to improving access to medical products in #Africa is the lack of strong national regulatory systems. To address that, all @_AfricanUnion countries signed a treaty at the AU Summit last year to create an African Medicines Agency"-@DrTedros https://t.co/npPnsZG1HP

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @InitiativeLome @WHOAFRO "...

Lack of technical capacity undermines the integrity of supply chains and limits the ability of countries to safeguard the health of their people"-@DrTedros #FakeDrugsRealCrime https://t.co/MmlKuCwqI4

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @InitiativeLome "There are several reasons for this problem.

Lack of access to affordable üíä forces desperate people to buy medicines from unreliable sources.

Lack of good governance allows corruption to penetrate health systems & leaves loopholes for criminal groups to exploit
..."-@DrTedros https://t.co/59Wjw5rPPT

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
@DrTedros @InitiativeLome "At best, these [substandard & falsified] üíä fail to treat or prevent disease, wasting precious resources & exploiting the hopes & fears of vulnerable people.

At worst, they kill and fan the flames of drug resistance, putting all of us at risk"-@DrTedros #FakeDrugsRealCrime https://t.co/EBO64LAbpP

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text: @DrTedros @InitiativeLome "Since 2012, WHO has issued 35 alerts of substandard & falsified products. Over 2/3 of these alerts have been issued in #Africa, primarily for ineffective or unsafe antibiotics & antimalarials"-@DrTedros #FakeDrugsRealCrime https://t.co/WjLHyqsfg9

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
"Over 1 in 10 medicines in low- & middle-income countries is either substandard or falsified. Last year alone, WHO issued 11 alerts globally. While this threat is global, #Africa bears the heaviest burden"-@DrTedros at the @InitiativeLome launch

#FakeDrugsRealCrime https://t.co/zbZThpKhz0

Q: Is there a treatment for a novel #coronavirus infection?
A: There is no specific treatment for disease caused by a novel coronavirus. However, many of the symptoms can be treated and therefore treatment is based on the patient‚Äôs clinical condition https://t.co/PKzKaO2yfK https://t.co/QxNg634JdS

text:
@WHOThailand @WHOKobe @WHOSEARO @WHOWPRO Q: What are the symptoms of #coronavirus infection?

name: World Health Organization (WHO)
text:
Novel coronaviruses emerge periodically, as we have seen. SARS emerged in 2002 and MERS emerged in 2012.
Several known coronaviruses are currently circulating in animals that have not yet infected humans.
